Development of nominal endings from PIE to Latin

Note "(<)" abbreviates "(fused with last stem sound (consonant or vowel))", "(<<)" abbreviates "(fused with last stem vowel + consonant)", "(–)" abbreviates "(previous vowel is lengthened)", "(v)" abbreviates "(previous vowel is shortened)", "?(x)" means "possibly x", "(x|y)" means "either x or y".

Late Proto-Indo-European (simplified)

This table omits the dual number, of which the development of Latin retains few if any traces. Not depicted, but part of Italic development: Pre-laryngeal e-ablauts were already laryngeally colored (i.e. phonetically eh₂ has become ah₂, and h₂e h₂a; Fortson p. 63; Meier-Brügger p. 244; Meiser p. 29; Sihler p. 42-50). Variations in athematic root/stem accent/ablaut are mostly ignored except for a few cases where stem ablauts easily fuse with the endings proper (i.e. i- and u-stems; see "genus"/"generis" for an ablaut graduation continued straight into Latin). Regarding consonant-stem singular nominatives, most scholars assume an -s ending, and for that -s ending to be dropped (with compensatory lengthening of the preceding vowel) after non-stops. Beekes p. 186 though assumes the opposite, consonant-stem nouns originally ending in -∅, with -s only copied over later from the o-stem nouns. For stems ending in -n- and -(d|t)-, the stem-final consonant may have dropped too, with any subsequent -s only kept in the latter (example *kwō from *kwon-: Beekes p. 194, Sihler p. 100, 230; example *pōs from *pod-: Sihler p. 130, 280; not depicted: Sihler p. 280 assumes for *pod- that the dental stop was later analogically restored, with the lengthened vowel kept: *pōts .) The accusative plural endings in -ns probably result from suffixing the plural nominative -s to the accusative singular -m (Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2084; Meier-Brügger p. 295). Not depicted: a thematic singular genitive in -os, only to be found in the Anatolian branch (Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2086), with -os?(i)o probably an early import from the pronouns (Beekes p. 213); an alternate athematic singular locative without ending (Sihler p. 248, 253); the u-stem dative singular ending in -i rather than -ei according to Beekes (p. 203), without explanation contrary to all other opinions. An athematic singular genitive/ablative in mere zero-grade ending -s may have been productiv in Italic for the i- and u-stems (with e/o-ablaut grade of the suffix), and is therefore depicted as a possibility, while a possible sibling for the consonantal stems is not depicted, since it only shows traces in other branches (Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2086).

thematic cons. -i- -u-
-(g|k|b|p)- -(d|t)- -n- &c.
sg:N -os -?s (-?s)|(-s (<,–))|(-∅ (–)) -?n (<,–) -∅ (–) -s
sg:V -e -∅ -ei (<) -(e|o)u (<)
sg:Ac -om -m
sg:n -om -∅
sg:G -os?(i)o -(e|o)s -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -(e|o)us (<), ?(-(e|o)s)
sg:Ab -oHed -(e|o)s -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -(e|o)us (<), ?(-(e|o)s)
sg:D -ōi -ei -eiei (<) -(e|o)uei (<)
sg:L -(e|o)i -i -ēi (<) -(ē|ō)u (<)
sg:I -(e|o)h₁ -?(e)h₁, -(bʰ|m)i -?(e)h₁, -(bʰ|m)i
pl:N/V -ōs -es -eies (<) -(e|o)ues (<)
pl:Ac -ons -ns
pl:n -eh₂ -h₂
pl:G -(o|oHo|ō)m -(o|oHo|ō)m
pl:D/Ab -o?(i)(bʰ?(i)|m)os -(bʰ?(i)|m)os
pl:L -oisu -su
pl:I -ōis -(bʰ|m)i?(s)
  • thematic singular animate nominative: -os (Beekes p. 212-213; Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Fortson p. 126-127; Meier-Brügger p. 332-333; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248, 250, 256; Szemerényi p. 194, 197; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083)
  • thematic singular animate vocative: -e (Beekes p. 212; Fortson p. 126; Meier-Brügger p. 332; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248, 250, 256; Szemerényi p. 194, 197; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083, 2090)
  • thematic singular animate accusative: -om (Beekes p. 212-213; Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Fortson p. 126; Meier-Brügger p. 332; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248, 250, 258; Szemerényi p. 194, 197; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083-2084)
  • thematic singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (Beekes p. 212-213; Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Fortson p. 126; Meier-Brügger p. 335; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248, 250, 258; Szemerényi p. 195, 197; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083-2084)
  • thematic singular dative: -ōi (Beekes p. 212-213; Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Fortson p. 126-127; Meier-Brügger p. 332; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248, 251, 258; Szemerényi p. 195, 197; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083, 2086)
  • thematic singular genitive: -os?(i)o (Beekes p. 212-213; Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Fortson p. 127; Meier-Brügger p. 332-333; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248, 259; Szemerényi p. 194-195, 197; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083, 2086-2087)
  • thematic singular ablative: -oHed (Beekes p. 213; Fortson p. 126-127; Meier-Brügger p. 332; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 251; Szemerényi p. 194; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083, 2087; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083, 2087)
  • thematic singular locative: -(e|o)i (Beekes p. 212-213; Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Fortson p. 126-127; Meier-Brügger p. 332; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248, 260; Szemerényi p. 195, 197; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083, 2086)
  • thematic singular instrumental: -(e|o)h₁ (Beekes p. 212-213; Fortson p. 126-127; Meier-Brügger p. 332; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248, 258; Szemerényi p. 195; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083, 2085)
  • consonant-stem in velar or bilabial stop singular animate nominative: -?s (Beekes p. 186, 208-209; Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Fortson p. 115; Meier-Brügger p. 330-331; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248, 250; Szemerényi p. 169; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083)
  • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative: (-?s)|(-s (<,–))|(-∅ (–)) (Beekes p. 186, 196-197, 208-209; Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Fortson p. 115; Meier-Brügger p. 330-331; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 130, 248, 250, 280; Szemerényi p. 122, 169, 173; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083)
  • consonant-stem in -n- singular animate nominative: -?n (<,–) (Beekes p. 194; Fortson p. 70; Sihler p. 100, 230, 290; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083)
  • consonant-stem not in -n- or stop singular animate nominative: -∅ (–) (Beekes p. 186; Fortson p. 70, 116; Meier-Brügger p. 283, 330-331; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 130, 248, 290, 303-304, 308; Szemerényi p. 121-122, 169; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083)
  • consonant-stem singular animate vocative: -∅ (Beekes p. 186; Fortson p. 116; Meier-Brügger p. 330; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248, 250; Szemerényi p. 169; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083, 2089)
  • athematic singular animate accusative: -m (Beekes p. 186-187; Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Fortson p. 115; Meier-Brügger p. 330-331; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248, 250; Szemerényi p. 169; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083-2084)
  • athematic singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (Beekes p. 186-187; Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Fortson p. 115; Meier-Brügger p. 335; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248, 250, 284, 293, 306; Szemerényi p. 169; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083-2084)
    • consonant-stem singular ablative: -(e|o)s
    • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)s

    (Beekes p. 186-187; Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Fortson p. 115-116; Meier-Brügger p. 330-331; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248, 250-251; Szemerényi p. 169; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083, 2087)

  • consonant-stem singular dative: -ei (Beekes p. 186-187; Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Fortson p. 115-116; Meier-Brügger p. 330; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248, 251, 284; Szemerényi p. 169; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083, 2085)
  • consonant-stem singular locative: -i (Beekes p. 186-187; Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Fortson p. 115-116; Meier-Brügger p. 330; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248, 253; Szemerényi p. 169; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083, 2085)
  • consonant-stem singular instrumental: -?(e)h₁, -(bʰ|m)i (Beekes p. 186-187; Fortson p. 115-116; Meier-Brügger p. 330-331; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 246-248, 251-252; Szemerényi p. 169; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083, 2085)
  • i/u-stem singular animate nominative: -s (Beekes p. 203; Meier-Brügger p. 342; Meiser p. 141-142; Sihler p. 248, 311, 315-316, 321-322; Szemerényi p. 186-187)
  • i/u-stem singular instrumental: -?(e)h₁, -(bʰ|m)i (Beekes p. 187, 203; Fortson p. 116; Sihler p. 248, 311, 321, 323)
  • i-stem singular animate vocative: -ei (<) (Beekes p. 203; Sihler p. 248, 311, 316; Szemerényi p. 186-187; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083, 2089-2090)
    • i-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s)
    • i-stem singular ablative: -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s)

    (Beekes p. 203; Meier-Brügger p. 342; Meiser p. 139; Sihler p. 248, 311, 316-317; Szemerényi p. 186-187; Weiss p. 245; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083, 2086)

  • i-stem singular dative: -eiei (<) (Meiser p. 139; Sihler p. 248, 311, 316; Szemerényi p. 187)
  • i-stem singular locative: -ēi (<) (Beekes p. 203; Meiser p. 140; Sihler p. 248, 311; Szemerényi p. 187)
  • u-stem singular animate vocative: -(e|o)u (<) (Beekes p. 203; Meiser p. 147; Sihler p. 248, 321-322; Szemerényi p. 186-187)
    • u-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)us (<), ?(-(e|o)s)
    • u-stem singular ablative: -(e|o)us (<), ?(-(e|o)s)

    (Beekes p. 203; Meiser p. 145; Sihler p. 248, 321, 324; Szemerényi p. 186-187; Weiss p. 251; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 761, 2083, 2086)

  • u-stem singular dative: -(e|o)uei (<) (Meiser p. 146; Sihler p. 248, 321, 323; Szemerényi p. 187)
  • u-stem singular locative: -(ē|ō)u (<) (Beekes p. 203; Meiser p. 147; Sihler p. 248, 321, 323-324; Szemerényi p. 187)
  • thematic plural animate nominative/vocative: -ōs (Beekes p. 212-213; Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Fortson p. 126, 128; Meier-Brügger p. 332; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248, 254, 261; Szemerényi p. 196-197; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083)
  • thematic plural animate accusative: -ons (Beekes p. 212-213; Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Fortson p. 126, 129; Meier-Brügger p. 332; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248, 254, 263; Szemerényi p. 196; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083-2084)
  • thematic plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -eh₂ (Fortson p. 126, 129; Meier-Brügger p. 335; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248, 254, 263; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083-2085)
  • thematic plural genitive: -(o|oHo|ō)m (Beekes p. 188, 212-213; Fortson p. 126, 129; Meier-Brügger p. 332; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248, 254-255, 264; Szemerényi p. 196-197; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083, 2089)
  • thematic plural dative/ablative: -o?(i)(bʰ?(i)|m)os (Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Fortson p. 126, 129; Meier-Brügger p. 332; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 246-248, 251-252; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2088-2089)
  • thematic plural locative: -oisu (Beekes p. 212-213; Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Fortson p. 126, 129; Meier-Brügger p. 332-333; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248, 253, 263; Szemerényi p. 196-197; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2089)
  • thematic plural instrumental: -ōis (Beekes p. 212-213; Fortson p. 126-127; Meier-Brügger p. 332; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248, 263-264; Szemerényi p. 197; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2088)
  • athematic plural animate accusative: -ns (Beekes p. 186, 188; Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Fortson p. 117; Meier-Brügger p. 330-331; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248, 254; Szemerényi p. 169; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083- 2084)
  • athematic plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -h₂ (Fortson p. 118; Meier-Brügger p. 335; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248, 254; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083-2085)
  • athematic plural dative/ablative: -(bʰ?(i)|m)os (Beekes p. 188-189; Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Fortson p. 117-119; Meier-Brügger p. 330, 332; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 246-248, 251-252; Szemerényi p. 169; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2088)
  • athematic plural locative: -su (Beekes p. 186, 189; Fortson p. 117-118; Meier-Brügger p. 330; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248, 253; Szemerényi p. 169; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2089)
  • athematic plural instrumental: -(bʰ|m)i?(s) (Beekes p. 186-187, 189; Fortson p. 117-119; Meier-Brügger p. 330, 332; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248; Szemerényi p. 169; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2087-2088)
  • athematic plural genitive: -(o|oHo|ō)m (Beekes p. 186, 188, 203; Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Fortson p. 117-118; Meier-Brügger p. 330-331; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248, 254-255, 311, 317, 321, 327; Szemerényi p. 169, 187; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083, 2089)
  • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -es (Beekes p. 186, 188; Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Fortson p. 117; Meier-Brügger p. 330; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248, 254, 286; Szemerényi p. 168-169; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083)
  • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -eies (<) (Beekes p. 203; Meiser p. 140; Sihler p. 248, 311, 317; Szemerényi p. 187)
  • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -(e|o)ues (<) (Beekes p. 203; Meiser p. 146; Sihler p. 248, 321, 325-326; Szemerényi p. 187)

    Late Proto-Indo-European eh₂ (feminine) declension

    Possibly after the split-off of the Anatolian branch, an explicitely feminine declension emerges, marked by a -eh₂- stem suffix to which athematic endings are appended (Beekes p. 189; Fortson p. 132-133; Meier-Brügger p. 323-324, 334-335, 421; Meiser p. 131; Sihler p. 245, 266). The singular vocative is a special case, with different theories about its form and the logic behind it.

    eh₂ thematic cons. -i- -u-
    -(g|k|b|p)- -(d|t)- -n- &c.
    sg:N -eh₂ -os -?s (-?s)|(-s (<,–))|(-∅ (–)) -?n (<,–) -∅ (–) -s
    sg:V -(e?(h₂)|h₂) -e -∅ -ei (<) -(e|o)u (<)
    sg:Ac -eh₂m -om -m
    sg:n -om -∅
    sg:G -eh₂(e|o)s -os?(i)o -(e|o)s -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -(e|o)us (<), ?(-(e|o)s)
    sg:Ab -eh₂(e|o)s -ōd -(e|o)s -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -(e|o)us (<), ?(-(e|o)s)
    sg:D -eh₂ei -ōi -ei -eiei (<) -(e|o)uei (<)
    sg:L -eh₂i -(e|o)i -i -ēi (<) -(ē|ō)u (<)
    sg:I -eh₂eh₁, -eh₂(bʰ|m)i -(e|o)h₁ -?(e)h₁, -(bʰ|m)i -?(e)h₁, -(bʰ|m)i
    pl:N/V -eh₂es -ōs -es -eies (<) -(e|o)ues (<)
    pl:Ac -eh₂ns -ons -ns
    pl:n -eh₂ -h₂
    pl:G -eh₂(o|oHo|ō)m -(o|oHo|ō)m -(o|oHo|ō)m
    pl:D/Ab -eh₂(bʰ?(i)|m)os -o?(i)(bʰ?(i)|m)os -(bʰ?(i)|m)os
    pl:L -eh₂su -oisu -su
    pl:I -eh₂(bʰ|m)is -ōis -(bʰ|m)i?(s)
    • eh₂-stem singular animate nominative: -eh₂ (Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Fortson p. 133; Meiser p. 131-132; Sihler p. 248, 266-268)
    • eh₂-stem singular animate vocative: -(e?(h₂)|h₂) (Fortson p. 133; Meier-Brügger p. 255; Meiser p. 131-132; Sihler p. 50, 248, 268)
    • eh₂-stem singular animate accusative: -eh₂m (Fortson p. 133; Meiser p. 131-132; Sihler p. 248, 268)
    • eh₂-stem singular dative: -eh₂ei (Meiser p. 131-132; Sihler p. 248, 268)
    • eh₂-stem singular genitive: -eh₂(e|o)s (Meiser p. 131-132; Sihler p. 248, 269)
    • eh₂-stem singular ablative: -eh₂(e|o)s (Meiser p. 131; Sihler p. 248)
    • eh₂-stem singular locative: -eh₂i (Meiser p. 131-132; Sihler p. 248, 270)
    • eh₂-stem singular instrumental: -eh₂eh₁, -eh₂(bʰ|m)i (Meiser p. 131-132; Sihler p. 248)
    • eh₂-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -eh₂es (Meiser p. 131-132; Sihler p. 248, 271)
    • eh₂-stem plural animate accusative: -eh₂ns (Fortson p. 131, 133; Meiser p. 131; Sihler p. 248, 271)
    • eh₂-stem plural genitive: -eh₂(o|oHo|ō)m (Meiser p. 131-132; Sihler p. 248, 272)
    • eh₂-stem plural dative/ablative: -eh₂(bʰ?(i)|m)os (Meiser p. 131, 133; Sihler p. 248)
    • eh₂-stem plural locative: -eh₂su (Meiser p. 131; Sihler p. 248)
    • eh₂-stem plural instrumental: -eh₂(bʰ|m)is (Meiser p. 131; Sihler p. 248)
      • thematic singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • thematic singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • thematic singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • thematic singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • thematic singular genitive: -os?(i)o (older)
      • thematic singular dative: -ōi (older)
      • thematic singular ablative: -ōd (older)
      • thematic singular locative: -(e|o)i (older)
      • thematic singular instrumental: -(e|o)h₁ (older)
      • athematic singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • athematic singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in velar or bilabial stop singular animate nominative: -?s (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative: (-?s)|(-s (<,–))|(-∅ (–)) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative: -?n (<,–) (older)
      • consonant-stem not in -n- or stop singular animate nominative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular animate vocative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: -(e|o)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ei (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: -i (older)
      • consonant-stem singular instrumental: -?(e)h₁, -(bʰ|m)i (older)
      • i/u-stem singular animate nominative: -s (older)
      • i/u-stem singular instrumental: -?(e)h₁, -(bʰ|m)i (older)
      • i-stem singular animate vocative: -ei (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) (older)
      • i-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) (older)
      • i-stem singular dative: -eiei (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: -ēi (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate vocative: -(e|o)u (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -(e|o)us (<), ?(-(e|o)s) (older)
      • u-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)us (<), ?(-(e|o)s) (older)
      • u-stem singular dative: -(e|o)uei (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular locative: -(ē|ō)u (<) (older)
      • thematic plural animate nominative/vocative: -ōs (older)
      • thematic plural animate accusative: -ons (older)
      • thematic plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -eh₂ (older)
      • thematic plural genitive: -(o|oHo|ō)m (older)
      • thematic plural dative/ablative: -o?(i)(bʰ?(i)|m)os (older)
      • thematic plural locative: -oisu (older)
      • thematic plural instrumental: -ōis (older)
      • athematic plural animate accusative: -ns (older)
      • athematic plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -h₂ (older)
      • athematic plural dative/ablative: -(bʰ?(i)|m)os (older)
      • athematic plural locative: -su (older)
      • athematic plural instrumental: -(bʰ|m)i?(s) (older)
      • athematic plural genitive: -(o|oHo|ō)m (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -es (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -eies (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -(e|o)ues (<) (older)

    Late Proto-Indo-European bʰ/m-branching

    In the Italic branch (among others), the endings starting in either -m- or -bʰ- generalize the latter.

    eh₂ thematic cons. -i- -u-
    -(g|k|b|p)- -(d|t)- -n- &c.
    sg:N -eh₂ -os -?s (-?s)|(-s (<,–))|(-∅ (–)) -?n (<,–) -∅ (–) -s
    sg:V -(e?(h₂)|h₂) -e -∅ -ei (<) -(e|o)u (<)
    sg:Ac -eh₂m -om -m
    sg:n -om -∅
    sg:G -eh₂(e|o)s -os?(i)o -(e|o)s -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -(e|o)us (<), ?(-(e|o)s)
    sg:Ab -eh₂(e|o)s -ōd -(e|o)s -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -(e|o)us (<), ?(-(e|o)s)
    sg:D -eh₂ei -ōi -ei -eiei (<) -(e|o)uei (<)
    sg:L -eh₂i -(e|o)i -i -ēi (<) -(ē|ō)u (<)
    sg:I -eh₂eh₁, -eh₂bʰi -(e|o)h₁ -?(e)h₁, -bʰi -?(e)h₁, -bʰi
    pl:N/V -eh₂es -ōs -es -eies (<) -(e|o)ues (<)
    pl:Ac -eh₂ns -ons -ns
    pl:n -eh₂ -h₂
    pl:G -eh₂(o|oHo|ō)m -(o|oHo|ō)m -(o|oHo|ō)m
    pl:D/Ab -eh₂bʰ?(i)os -o?(i)bʰ?(i)os -bʰ?(i)os
    pl:L -eh₂su -oisu -su
    pl:I -eh₂bʰis -ōis -bʰi?(s)
    • consonant-stem singular instrumental: -?(e)h₁, -bʰi (Beekes p. 186-187; Fortson p. 115-116; Meier-Brügger p. 330-331; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 246-248, 251-252; Szemerényi p. 169; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083, 2085)
    • i/u-stem singular instrumental: -?(e)h₁, -bʰi (Beekes p. 187, 203; Fortson p. 116; Sihler p. 248, 311, 321, 323)
    • thematic plural dative/ablative: -o?(i)bʰ?(i)os (Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Fortson p. 126, 129; Meier-Brügger p. 332; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 246-248, 251-252; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2088-2089)
    • athematic plural dative/ablative: -bʰ?(i)os (Beekes p. 188-189; Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Fortson p. 117-119; Meier-Brügger p. 330, 332; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 246-248, 251-252; Szemerényi p. 169; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2088)
    • athematic plural instrumental: -bʰi?(s) (Beekes p. 186-187, 189; Fortson p. 117-119; Meier-Brügger p. 330, 332; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248; Szemerényi p. 169; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2087-2088)
    • eh₂-stem singular instrumental: -eh₂eh₁, -eh₂bʰi (Meiser p. 131-132; Sihler p. 248)
    • eh₂-stem plural dative/ablative: -eh₂bʰ?(i)os (Meiser p. 131, 133; Sihler p. 248)
    • eh₂-stem plural instrumental: -eh₂bʰis (Meiser p. 131; Sihler p. 248)
      • eh₂-stem singular animate nominative: -eh₂ (older)
      • eh₂-stem singular animate vocative: -(e?(h₂)|h₂) (older)
      • eh₂-stem singular animate accusative: -eh₂m (older)

      • athematic plural animate accusative: -ns (older)
      • athematic plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -h₂ (older)
      • athematic plural locative: -su (older)
      • athematic plural genitive: -(o|oHo|ō)m (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -es (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -eies (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -(e|o)ues (<) (older)

    Proto-Italic loss of laryngeals, and Proto-Indo-European laryngeal coloring

    The laryngeals disappear. Vowels neighboring lost laryngeals are left in their phonetic laryngeal coloring (i.e. -e- as -a- when neighbor to -h₂-), and lengthened if the lost laryngeal came after and was word-final or followed by a consonant (Beekes p. 149-150; Clackson/Horrocks p. 9-10; Fortson p. 63-64; Meier-Brügger p. 244; Meiser p. 28-30, 56-57; Sihler p. 42-50). Word-final post-consonantal laryngeals (maybe even after -u: Meiser p. 147) become -a (Sihler p. 99; Meiser p. 107). From these changes, vowel neighborships -aa- (a-stem dative singular), -āā- (a-stem instrumental singular) and (possibly with the a-stem genitive/ablative singular) -ao- emerge that contract to -ā- (Meiser p. 87-88; Sihler p. 83). Post-laryngeal continuation of former eh₂-stem singular instrumental ending -eh₂bʰi is not directly discussed in the literature, but would have given -ābʰi by these rules. The a-stem singular vocative form reflects no single rule path, but an uncertainty that fits the variety of theories about its original form. The i/u-stem singular instrumentals in -ī (<) and -ū (<) are not directly attested for Italic, but are the logical result of the above rules also found in Vedic and Avestan and speculatively included here as such (Fortson p. 116, Sihler p. 312, 323).

    a o cons. -i- -u-
    -(g|k|b|p)- -(d|t)- -n- &c.
    sg:N -ā -os -?s (-?s)|(-s (<,–))|(-∅ (–)) -?n (<,–) -∅ (–) -s
    sg:V -(a|ā) -e -∅ -ei (<) -(e|o)u (<)
    sg:Ac -ām -om -m
    sg:n -om -∅
    sg:G -ās -os?(i)o -(e|o)s -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -(e|o)us (<), ?(-(e|o)s)
    sg:Ab -ās -ōd -(e|o)s -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -(e|o)us (<), ?(-(e|o)s)
    sg:D -āi -ōi -ei -eiei (<) -(e|o)uei (<)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -(e|o)i -i -ēi (<) -(ē|ō)u (<)
    sg:I -ā -(ē|ō) -(ē|a), -bʰi -ī (<), -bʰi -ū (<), -bʰi
    pl:N/V -ās -ōs -es -eies (<) -(e|o)ues (<)
    pl:Ac -āns -ons -ns
    pl:n -ā -a -ī (<) -(ua|ū) (<)
    pl:G -a(o|ō)m -(o|ō)m -(o|ō)m
    pl:D/Ab -ābʰ?(i)os -o?(i)bʰ?(i)os -bʰ?(i)os
    pl:L -āsu -oisu -su
    pl:I -ābʰis -ōis -bʰi?(s)
    • a-stem singular animate nominative: -ā (Meiser p. 131-132; Sihler p. 266-267)
    • a-stem singular animate vocative: -(a|ā) (Fortson p. 133; Meier-Brügger p. 255; Meiser p. 131-132; Sihler p. 50, 268)
    • a-stem singular animate accusative: -ām (Meiser p. 131-132; Sihler p. 267-268)
    • a-stem singular dative: -āi (Meiser p. 131-132; Sihler p. 267-269)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ās
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ās

      (Meiser p. 131-132; Sihler p. 267, 269)

    • a-stem singular instrumental: -ā (Meiser p. 131-132; Sihler p. 268)
    • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (Meiser p. 131; Sihler p. 270)
    • o-stem singular ablative: -ōd (Beekes p. 212-213; Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Fortson p. 126-128; Meier-Brügger p. 332; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 228, 248, 250-251, 258; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2087)
    • o-stem singular instrumental: -(ē|ō) (Fortson p. 126-127; Sihler p. 258-259)
    • consonant-stem singular instrumental: -(ē|a), -bʰi (Fortson p. 116; Sihler p. 248, 285)
    • i-stem singular instrumental: -ī (<), -bʰi (Fortson p. 116; Sihler p. 248, 312)
    • u-stem singular instrumental: -ū (<), -bʰi (Fortson p. 116; Sihler p. 248, 323)
    • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ās (Meiser p. 131-132; Sihler p. 270-271)
    • a-stem plural animate accusative: -āns (Meiser p. 131-132; Sihler p. 271)
    • a-stem plural genitive: -a(o|ō)m (Sihler p. 272)
    • a-stem plural instrumental: -ābʰis (Meiser p. 131)
    • a-stem plural locative: -āsu (Meiser p. 131)
    • a-stem plural dative/ablative: -ābʰ?(i)os (Meiser p. 131)
    • o-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -ā (Meiser p. 136; Sihler p. 263)
    • o-stem plural genitive: -(o|ō)m (Beekes p. 188, 212-213; Fortson p. 126, 129; Meier-Brügger p. 332; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248, 254-255, 264; Szemerényi p. 196-197;)
    • athematic plural genitive: -(o|ō)m (Beekes p. 186, 188, 203; Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Fortson p. 117-118; Meier-Brügger p. 330-331; Meiser p. 34;Sihler p. 248, 254-255, 311, 317, 321, 327; Szemerényi p. 169, 187; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083, 2089)
    • consonant-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -a (Meiser p. 107, 144; Sihler p. 99, 286)
    • i-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -ī (<) (Sihler p. 317)
    • u-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -(ua|ū) (<) (Sihler p. 326, Meiser p. 147)
      • o-stem singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular genitive: -os?(i)o (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ōi (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -(e|o)i (older)

      • o-stem plural locative: -oisu (older)

      • athematic plural dative/ablative: -bʰ?(i)os (older)

      • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -es (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -eies (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -(e|o)ues (<) (older)

    Proto-Italic fusion of (dative-)ablative and instrumental

    Ablative and instrumental fuse to the new ablative (Clackson/Horrocks p. 14-15; Fortson p. 281; Meiser p. 128; Sihler p. 252-253, 258), in the plural together with the formally already identical dative (Meiser p. 128-129, Sihler p. 264): The o-stem instrumental plural ending -ōis replaces the dative/ablative ending. The a-stem dative/ablative plural ending is re-shaped after the result to -āis. In the singular, the pattern of the o-stem ablative ending -ōd is generalized to most other stems. (There may have been an intermediate stage where the singular instrumental endings -ā, -ī, -ū replaced the old ablative endings not as distinctive as -ōd, and were then re-shaped by mere addition of its -d.) Whether this pattern extended to the consonantal stems as -ēd is questionable (Weiss p. 202, 238 vs. Meiser p. 138; Sihler p. 285 tentatively proposes the possibility of a continuation in mere instrumental -ē without final -d).

    a o cons. -i- -u-
    -(g|k|b|p)- -(d|t)- -n- &c.
    sg:N -ā -os -?s (-?s)|(-s (<,–))|(-∅ (–)) -?n (<,–) -∅ (–) -s
    sg:V -(a|ā) -e -∅ -ei (<) -(e|o)u (<)
    sg:Ac -ām -om -m
    sg:n -om -∅
    sg:G -ās -os?(i)o -(e|o)s -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -(e|o)us (<), ?(-(e|o)s)
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) -īd (<) -ūd (<)
    sg:D -āi -ōi -ei -eiei (<) -(e|o)uei (<)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -(e|o)i -i -ēi (<) -(ē|ō)u (<)
    pl:N/V -ās -ōs -es -eies (<) -(e|o)ues (<)
    pl:Ac -āns -ons -ns
    pl:n -ā -a -ī (<) -(ua|ū) (<)
    pl:G -a(o|ō)m -(o|ō)m -(o|ō)m
    pl:D/Ab -āis -ōis -bʰ?(i)os
    pl:L -āsu -oisu -su
    • a-stem singular ablative: -ād (Fortson p. 281; Meiser p. 128, 132; Sihler p. 258, 269)
    • consonant-stem singular ablative: ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) (Clackson/Horrocks p. 15-16; Meiser p. 128, 138, 144; Sihler p. 285; Weiss p. 202; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 758-759)
    • i-stem singular ablative: -īd (<) (Clackson/Horrocks p. 15-16; Meiser p. 128, 132, 144; Sihler p. 317)
    • u-stem singular ablative: -ūd (<) (Clackson/Horrocks p. 15-16; Fortson p. 281; Meiser p. 128, 144; Sihler p. 324)
    • a-stem plural dative/ablative: -āis (Meiser p. 128, 133; Sihler p. 272)
    • o-stem plural dative/ablative: -ōis (Meiser p. 128, 136; Sihler p. 263)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative: -ā (older)
      • a-stem singular animate vocative: -(a|ā) (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -ām (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ās (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (older)
      • o-stem singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular genitive: -os?(i)o (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ōi (older)

      • athematic singular animate accusative: -m (older)

      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative: (-?s)|(-s (<,–))|(-∅ (–)) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative: -?n (<,–) (older)
      • consonant-stem not in -n- or stop singular animate nominative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular animate vocative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ei (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: -i (older)
      • i/u-stem singular animate nominative: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular animate vocative: -ei (<) (older)

      • i-stem singular dative: -eiei (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: -ēi (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate vocative: -(e|o)u (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)us (<), ?(-(e|o)s) (older)
      • u-stem singular dative: -(e|o)uei (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular locative: -(ē|ō)u (<) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ās (older)

      • i-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -ī (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -(e|o)ues (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -(ua|ū) (<) (older)

    Proto-Italic influence of Osthoff's Law

    As per Osthoff's Law, long vowels before resonants are shortened if the latter are followed by consonants (Meiser p. 75; Sihler p. 58).

    a o cons. -i- -u-
    -(g|k|b|p)- -(d|t)- -n- &c.
    sg:N -ā -os -?s (-?s)|(-s (<,–))|(-∅ (–)) -?n (<,–) -∅ (–) -s
    sg:V -(a|ā) -e -∅ -ei (<) -(e|o)u (<)
    sg:Ac -ām -om -m
    sg:n -om -∅
    sg:G -ās -os?(i)o -(e|o)s -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -(e|o)us (<), ?(-(e|o)s)
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) -īd (<) -ūd (<)
    sg:D -āi -ōi -ei -eiei (<) -(e|o)uei (<)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -(e|o)i -i -ēi (<) -(ē|ō)u (<)
    pl:N/V -ās -ōs -es -eies (<) -(e|o)ues (<)
    pl:Ac -ans -ons -ns
    pl:n -ā -a -ī (<) -(ua|ū) (<)
    pl:G -a(o|ō)m -(o|ō)m -(o|ō)m
    pl:D/Ab -ais -ois -bʰ?(i)os
    pl:L -āsu -oisu -su
    • a-stem plural dative/ablative: -ais (Meiser p. 128, 133; Sihler p. 272)
    • o-stem plural dative/ablative: -ois (Meiser p. 128, 136; Sihler p. 263)
    • a-stem plural animate accusative: -ans (Sihler p. 254, 271)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative: -ā (older)
      • a-stem singular animate vocative: -(a|ā) (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -ām (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ās (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ād (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (older)
      • o-stem singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular genitive: -os?(i)o (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ōi (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ōd (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -(e|o)i (older)
      • athematic singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • athematic singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in velar or bilabial stop singular animate nominative: -?s (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative: (-?s)|(-s (<,–))|(-∅ (–)) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative: -?n (<,–) (older)
      • consonant-stem not in -n- or stop singular animate nominative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular animate vocative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ei (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: -i (older)
      • i/u-stem singular animate nominative: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular animate vocative: -ei (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -īd (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) (older)
      • i-stem singular dative: -eiei (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: -ēi (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate vocative: -(e|o)u (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ūd (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)us (<), ?(-(e|o)s) (older)
      • u-stem singular dative: -(e|o)uei (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular locative: -(ē|ō)u (<) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ās (older)
      • a-stem plural genitive: -a(o|ō)m (older)
      • a-stem plural locative: -āsu (older)
      • o-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ōs (older)
      • o-stem plural animate accusative: -ons (older)
      • o-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -ā (older)
      • o-stem plural genitive: -(o|ō)m (older)
      • o-stem plural locative: -oisu (older)
      • athematic plural animate accusative: -ns (older)
      • athematic plural dative/ablative: -bʰ?(i)os (older)
      • athematic plural locative: -su (older)
      • athematic plural genitive: -(o|ō)m (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -es (older)
      • consonant-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -a (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -eies (<) (older)
      • i-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -ī (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -(e|o)ues (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -(ua|ū) (<) (older)

    Proto-Italic (sound) changes to the plural athematic ablative/dative

    The voiced aspirate -bʰ- in medial positions transforms to the voiceless labiodental fricative -f- (Sihler p. 139-141) or the voiced bilabial fricative -β- (Meiser p. 101-103; Clackson/Horrocks p. 51-52; Weiss p. 149-150; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 744-745). An -i- that follows this sound in some Indo-European branches disappears in Proto-Italic (Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2088).

    a o cons. -i- -u-
    -(g|k|b|p)- -(d|t)- -n- &c.
    sg:N -ā -os -?s (-?s)|(-s (<,–))|(-∅ (–)) -?n (<,–) -∅ (–) -s
    sg:V -(a|ā) -e -∅ -ei (<) -(e|o)u (<)
    sg:Ac -ām -om -m
    sg:n -om -∅
    sg:G -ās -os?(i)o -(e|o)s -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -(e|o)us (<), ?(-(e|o)s)
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) -īd (<) -ūd (<)
    sg:D -āi -ōi -ei -eiei (<) -(e|o)uei (<)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -(e|o)i -i -ēi (<) -(ē|ō)u (<)
    pl:N/V -ās -ōs -es -eies (<) -(e|o)ues (<)
    pl:Ac -ans -ons -ns
    pl:n -ā -a -ī (<) -(ua|ū) (<)
    pl:G -a(o|ō)m -(o|ō)m -(o|ō)m
    pl:D/Ab -ais -ois -(f|β)os
    pl:L -āsu -oisu -su
    • athematic plural dative/ablative: -(f|β)os (Sihler p. 286, 318)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative: -ā (older)
      • a-stem singular animate vocative: -(a|ā) (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -ām (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ās (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ād (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (older)
      • o-stem singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular genitive: -os?(i)o (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ōi (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ōd (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -(e|o)i (older)
      • athematic singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • athematic singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in velar or bilabial stop singular animate nominative: -?s (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative: (-?s)|(-s (<,–))|(-∅ (–)) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative: -?n (<,–) (older)
      • consonant-stem not in -n- or stop singular animate nominative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular animate vocative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ei (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: -i (older)
      • i/u-stem singular animate nominative: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular animate vocative: -ei (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -īd (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) (older)
      • i-stem singular dative: -eiei (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: -ēi (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate vocative: -(e|o)u (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ūd (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)us (<), ?(-(e|o)s) (older)
      • u-stem singular dative: -(e|o)uei (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular locative: -(ē|ō)u (<) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ās (older)
      • a-stem plural animate accusative: -ans (older)
      • a-stem plural genitive: -a(o|ō)m (older)
      • a-stem plural dative/ablative: -ais (older)
      • a-stem plural locative: -āsu (older)
      • o-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ōs (older)
      • o-stem plural animate accusative: -ons (older)
      • o-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -ā (older)
      • o-stem plural genitive: -(o|ō)m (older)
      • o-stem plural dative/ablative: -ois (older)
      • o-stem plural locative: -oisu (older)
      • athematic plural animate accusative: -ns (older)
      • athematic plural genitive: -(o|ō)m (older)
      • athematic plural locative: -su (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -es (older)
      • consonant-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -a (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -eies (<) (older)
      • i-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -ī (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -(e|o)ues (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -(ua|ū) (<) (older)

    Proto-Italic vocative losses/merges/contractions

    In the athematic stems, the singular vocative disappears/merges with the nominative (Sihler p. 283, 316, 322; Meiser p. 138-139, 147). Latin "Iuppiter" preserves a trace of the endingless u-stem singular vocative, as composite of vocative *dieu with *pāter (Meiser p. 138, 144; Weiss p. 200). In the io-stems, the vocative -i-e may possibly contract to -ī (safely attested in Old Latin, but a bit controversial as a Proto-Italic stage: Weiss p. 221; Leumann p. 424-425; Sihler p. 257-258).

    a o cons. -i- -u-
    &c. -i- -(g|k|b|p)- -(d|t)- -n- &c.
    sg:N -ā -os -?s (-?s)|(-s (<,–))|(-∅ (–)) -?n (<,–) -∅ (–) -s
    sg:V -(a|ā) -e (-e)|(-ī (<))
    sg:Ac -ām -om -m
    sg:n -om -∅
    sg:G -ās -os?(i)o -(e|o)s -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -(e|o)us (<), ?(-(e|o)s)
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) -īd (<) -ūd (<)
    sg:D -āi -ōi -ei -eiei (<) -(e|o)uei (<)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -(e|o)i -i -ēi (<) -(ē|ō)u (<)
    pl:N/V -ās -ōs -es -eies (<) -(e|o)ues (<)
    pl:Ac -ans -ons -ns
    pl:n -ā -a -ī (<) -(ua|ū) (<)
    pl:G -a(o|ō)m -(o|ō)m -(o|ō)m
    pl:D/Ab -ais -ois -(f|β)os
    pl:L -āsu -oisu -su
    • consonant-stem in velar or bilabial stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -?s (Beekes p. 186, 208-209; Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Fortson p. 115; Meier-Brügger p. 330-331; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 248, 250; Szemerényi p. 169; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083)
    • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: (-?s)|(-s (<,–))|(-∅ (–)) (Beekes p. 186, 196-197, 208-209; Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Fortson p. 115; Meier-Brügger p. 330-331; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 130, 248, 250, 280; Szemerényi p. 122, 169, 173; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083)
    • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?n (<,–) (Beekes p. 194; Fortson p. 70; Sihler p. 100, 230, 290; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083)
    • consonant-stem not in -n- or stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (Beekes p. 186; Fortson p. 70, 116; Meier-Brügger p. 283, 330-331; Meiser p. 34; Sihler p. 130, 248, 290, 303-304, 308; Szemerényi p. 121-122, 169; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2083)
    • i/u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (Beekes p. 203; Meier-Brügger p. 342; Meiser p. 141-142; Sihler p. 248, 311, 315-316, 321-322; Szemerényi p. 186-187)
    • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: (-e)|(-ī (<)) (Sihler p. 257-258; Leumann p. 424-425; Weiss p. 221; Meiser p. 134)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative: -ā (older)
      • a-stem singular animate vocative: -(a|ā) (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -ām (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ās (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ād (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (older)
      • o-stem singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular genitive: -os?(i)o (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ōi (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ōd (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -(e|o)i (older)
      • athematic singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • athematic singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ei (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: -i (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -īd (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) (older)
      • i-stem singular dative: -eiei (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: -ēi (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ūd (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)us (<), ?(-(e|o)s) (older)
      • u-stem singular dative: -(e|o)uei (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular locative: -(ē|ō)u (<) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ās (older)

      • o-stem plural dative/ablative: -ois (older)
      • o-stem plural locative: -oisu (older)

      • athematic plural dative/ablative: -(f|β)os (older)
      • athematic plural genitive: -(o|ō)m (older)
      • athematic plural locative: -su (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -es (older)
      • consonant-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -a (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -eies (<) (older)
      • i-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -ī (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -(e|o)ues (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -(ua|ū) (<) (older)

    Proto-Italic assimilation of e to o before u

    Before u, (short) e becomes o (Sihler p. 40, 56; Meiser p. 59; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 746). The u-stem plural nominative/locative in -oues is here depicted as the regular result, although Sihler p. 325 states: "for some reason, that is not generally regarded as likely."

    a o cons. -i- -u-
    &c. -i- -(g|k|b|p)- -(d|t)- -n- &c.
    sg:N -ā -os -?s (-?s)|(-s (<,–))|(-∅ (–)) -?n (<,–) -∅ (–) -s
    sg:V -(a|ā) -e (-e)|(-ī (<))
    sg:Ac -ām -om -m
    sg:n -om -∅
    sg:G -ās -os?(i)o -(e|o)s -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -ous (<), ?(-(e|o)s)
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) -īd (<) -ūd (<)
    sg:D -āi -ōi -ei -eiei (<) -ouei (<)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -(e|o)i -i -ēi (<) -(ē|ō)u (<)
    pl:N/V -ās -ōs -es -eies (<) -oues (<)
    pl:Ac -ans -ons -ns
    pl:n -ā -a -ī (<) -(ua|ū) (<)
    pl:G -a(o|ō)m -(o|ō)m -(o|ō)m
    pl:D/Ab -ais -ois -(f|β)os
    pl:L -āsu -oisu -su
    • u-stem singular genitive: -ous (<), ?(-(e|o)s) (Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Sihler p. 248, 321, 324; Weiss p. 251; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 761)
    • u-stem singular dative: -ouei (<) (Sihler p. 323)
    • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -oues (<) (Sihler p. 325; Meiser p. 146)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative: -ā (older)
      • a-stem singular animate vocative: -(a|ā) (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -ām (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ās (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ād (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (older)
      • o-stem singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: (-e)|(-ī (<)) (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular genitive: -os?(i)o (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ōi (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ōd (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -(e|o)i (older)
      • athematic singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • athematic singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in velar or bilabial stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -?s (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: (-?s)|(-s (<,–))|(-∅ (–)) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?n (<,–) (older)
      • consonant-stem not in -n- or stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ei (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: -i (older)
      • i/u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -īd (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) (older)
      • i-stem singular dative: -eiei (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: -ēi (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ūd (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular locative: -(ē|ō)u (<) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ās (older)
      • a-stem plural animate accusative: -ans (older)
      • a-stem plural genitive: -a(o|ō)m (older)
      • a-stem plural dative/ablative: -ais (older)
      • a-stem plural locative: -āsu (older)
      • o-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ōs (older)
      • o-stem plural animate accusative: -ons (older)
      • o-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -ā (older)
      • o-stem plural genitive: -(o|ō)m (older)
      • o-stem plural dative/ablative: -ois (older)
      • o-stem plural locative: -oisu (older)
      • athematic plural animate accusative: -ns (older)
      • athematic plural dative/ablative: -(f|β)os (older)
      • athematic plural genitive: -(o|ō)m (older)
      • athematic plural locative: -su (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -es (older)
      • consonant-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -a (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -eies (<) (older)
      • i-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -ī (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -(ua|ū) (<) (older)

    Proto-Italic contraction of -eie- to -ē-, and -ēi to -ei-

    The singular i-stem dative ending in -eiei is contracted to -ei, either by haplology (Meiser p. 139, Szemerényi p. 187), or by a regular Proto-Italic loss of intervocalic -i- (Sihler p. 188; Meiser p. 91; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 747) shortening -eiei to -eei, which regularly becomes -ēi (Sihler p. 83, Meiser p. 87), then -ei. Loss of intervocalic -i- would also explain the development of the i-stem nominative/vocative plural (Clackson/Horrocks p. 102, Szemerényi p. 187).

    a o cons. -i- -u-
    &c. -i- -(g|k|b|p)- -(d|t)- -n- &c.
    sg:N -ā -os -?s (-?s)|(-s (<,–))|(-∅ (–)) -?n (<,–) -∅ (–) -s
    sg:V -(a|ā) -e (-e)|(-ī (<))
    sg:Ac -ām -om -m
    sg:n -om -∅
    sg:G -ās -os?(i)o -(e|o)s -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -ous (<), ?(-(e|o)s)
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) -īd (<) -ūd (<)
    sg:D -āi -ōi -ei -ei (<) -ouei (<)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -(e|o)i -i -ei (<) -(ē|ō)u (<)
    pl:N/V -ās -ōs -es -ēs (<) -oues (<)
    pl:Ac -ans -ons -ns
    pl:n -ā -a -ī (<) -(ua|ū) (<)
    pl:G -a(o|ō)m -(o|ō)m -(o|ō)m
    pl:D/Ab -ais -ois -(f|β)os
    pl:L -āsu -oisu -su
    • i-stem singular dative: -ei (<) (Sihler p. 316; Meiser p. 138-139; Szemerényi p. 187)
    • i-stem singular locative: -ei (<) (Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 759; Weiss p. 243)
    • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (<) (Clackson/Horrocks p. 102; Sihler p. 317; Meiser p. 140; Szemerényi p. 187)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative: -ā (older)
      • a-stem singular animate vocative: -(a|ā) (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -ām (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ās (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ād (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (older)
      • o-stem singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: (-e)|(-ī (<)) (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular genitive: -os?(i)o (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ōi (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ōd (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -(e|o)i (older)
      • athematic singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • athematic singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in velar or bilabial stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -?s (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: (-?s)|(-s (<,–))|(-∅ (–)) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?n (<,–) (older)
      • consonant-stem not in -n- or stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ei (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: -i (older)
      • i/u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -īd (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate vocative: (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ūd (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular genitive: -ous (<), ?(-(e|o)s) (older)
      • u-stem singular dative: -ouei (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular locative: -(ē|ō)u (<) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ās (older)
      • a-stem plural animate accusative: -ans (older)
      • a-stem plural genitive: -a(o|ō)m (older)
      • a-stem plural dative/ablative: -ais (older)
      • a-stem plural locative: -āsu (older)
      • o-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ōs (older)
      • o-stem plural animate accusative: -ons (older)
      • o-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -ā (older)
      • o-stem plural genitive: -(o|ō)m (older)
      • o-stem plural dative/ablative: -ois (older)
      • o-stem plural locative: -oisu (older)
      • athematic plural animate accusative: -ns (older)
      • athematic plural dative/ablative: -(f|β)os (older)
      • athematic plural genitive: -(o|ō)m (older)
      • athematic plural locative: -su (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -es (older)
      • consonant-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -a (older)
      • i-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -ī (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -(ua|ū) (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -oues (<) (older)

    Proto-Italic plural ablative/dative/locative

    In the plurals, dative/ablative and locative fuse to one common form per stem. In the a/o-stems, this form is identical to the plural dative/ablative's original form. In the o-stems, the result of -ois would have been equal to the locative ending -oisu on loss of its -u (Meiser p. 74), which may have happened at the same time. This formal identity between dative/ablative and locative may have spread to the other stems. The extension of the athematic dative/ablative to the locative is somewhat speculative (Meiser p. 129 "mag verwendet worden sein", offers a Sabellic example though similar to the later Latin outcome).

    a o cons. -i- -u-
    &c. -i- -(g|k|b|p)- -(d|t)- -n- &c.
    sg:N -ā -os -?s (-?s)|(-s (<,–))|(-∅ (–)) -?n (<,–) -∅ (–) -s
    sg:V -(a|ā) -e (-e)|(-ī (<))
    sg:Ac -ām -om -m
    sg:n -om -∅
    sg:G -ās -os?(i)o -(e|o)s -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -ous (<), ?(-(e|o)s)
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) -īd (<) -ūd (<)
    sg:D -āi -ōi -ei -ei (<) -ouei (<)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -(e|o)i -i -ei (<) -(ē|ō)u (<)
    pl:N/V -ās -ōs -es -ēs (<) -oues (<)
    pl:Ac -ans -ons -ns
    pl:n -ā -a -ī (<) -(ua|ū) (<)
    pl:G -a(o|ō)m -(o|ō)m -(o|ō)m
    pl:D/Ab/L -ais -ois -(f|β)os
    • a-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ais (Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Meiser p. 133; Sihler p. 272)
    • o-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ois (Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Meiser p. 129, 136; Sihler p. 263-264)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative: -ā (older)
      • a-stem singular animate vocative: -(a|ā) (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -ām (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ās (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ād (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (older)
      • o-stem singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: (-e)|(-ī (<)) (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular genitive: -os?(i)o (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ōi (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ōd (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -(e|o)i (older)
      • athematic singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • athematic singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in velar or bilabial stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -?s (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: (-?s)|(-s (<,–))|(-∅ (–)) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?n (<,–) (older)
      • consonant-stem not in -n- or stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ei (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: -i (older)
      • i/u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -īd (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) (older)
      • i-stem singular dative: -ei (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: -ei (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ūd (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular genitive: -ous (<), ?(-(e|o)s) (older)
      • u-stem singular dative: -ouei (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular locative: -(ē|ō)u (<) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ās (older)
      • a-stem plural animate accusative: -ans (older)
      • a-stem plural genitive: -a(o|ō)m (older)
      • o-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ōs (older)
      • o-stem plural animate accusative: -ons (older)
      • o-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -ā (older)
      • o-stem plural genitive: -(o|ō)m (older)
      • athematic plural animate accusative: -ns (older)
      • athematic plural dative/ablative/locative: -(f|β)os (older)
      • athematic plural genitive: -(o|ō)m (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -es (older)
      • consonant-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -a (older)
      • i-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -ī (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -(ua|ū) (<) (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -oues (<) (older)

    Proto-Italic a-stem plural genitive

    The a-stem plural genitive ending is re-shaped after the respective pronoun form.

    a o cons. -i- -u-
    &c. -i- -(g|k|b|p)- -(d|t)- -n- &c.
    sg:N -ā -os -?s (-?s)|(-s (<,–))|(-∅ (–)) -?n (<,–) -∅ (–) -s
    sg:V -(a|ā) -e (-e)|(-ī (<))
    sg:Ac -ām -om -m
    sg:n -om -∅
    sg:G -ās -os?(i)o -(e|o)s -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -ous (<), ?(-(e|o)s)
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) -īd (<) -ūd (<)
    sg:D -āi -ōi -ei -ei (<) -ouei (<)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -(e|o)i -i -ei (<) -(ē|ō)u (<)
    pl:N/V -ās -ōs -es -ēs (<) -oues (<)
    pl:Ac -ans -ons -ns
    pl:n -ā -a -ī (<) -(ua|ū) (<)
    pl:G -ās(o|ō)m -(o|ō)m -(o|ō)m
    pl:D/Ab/L -ais -ois -(f|β)os
    • a-stem plural genitive: -ās(o|ō)m (Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Meiser p. 132; Sihler p. 272; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 757; Weiss p. 236)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative: -ā (older)
      • a-stem singular animate vocative: -(a|ā) (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -ām (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ās (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ād (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (older)
      • o-stem singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: (-e)|(-ī (<)) (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular genitive: -os?(i)o (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ōi (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ōd (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -(e|o)i (older)
      • athematic singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • athematic singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)

      • consonant-stem not in -n- or stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ei (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: -i (older)
      • i/u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -īd (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) (older)
      • i-stem singular dative: -ei (<) (older)

      • u-stem singular locative: -(ē|ō)u (<) (older)

      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -oues (<) (older)

    Proto-Italic u-stem singular dative

    A u-stem singular dative in -ou appears, either in analogy to the i-stem ending (-ei to -ou: Sihler p. 323; Weiss p. 251; Bakkum p. 146; Meiser p. 146; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 761), or derived from the locative (Sihler). (Note that Meiser and Bakkum seem to see this ending as older than -ouei or -uei, with the latter modelled later after the consonant-stem endings.)

    a o cons. -i- -u-
    &c. -i- -(g|k|b|p)- -(d|t)- -n- &c.
    sg:N -ā -os -?s (-?s)|(-s (<,–))|(-∅ (–)) -?n (<,–) -∅ (–) -s
    sg:V -(a|ā) -e (-e)|(-ī (<))
    sg:Ac -ām -om -m
    sg:n -om -∅
    sg:G -ās -os?(i)o -(e|o)s -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -ous (<), ?(-(e|o)s)
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) -īd (<) -ūd (<)
    sg:D -āi -ōi -ei -ei (<) -ouei (<), -ou (<)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -(e|o)i -i -ei (<) -(ē|ō)u (<)
    pl:N/V -ās -ōs -es -ēs (<) -oues (<)
    pl:Ac -ans -ons -ns
    pl:n -ā -a -ī (<) -(ua|ū) (<)
    pl:G -ās(o|ō)m -(o|ō)m -(o|ō)m
    pl:D/Ab/L -ais -ois -(f|β)os
    • u-stem singular dative: -ouei (<), -ou (<) (Meiser p. 145-146; Sihler p. 323; Weiss p. 251; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 761; Bakkum p. 146)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative: -ā (older)
      • a-stem singular animate vocative: -(a|ā) (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -ām (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ās (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ād (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (older)
      • o-stem singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: (-e)|(-ī (<)) (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular genitive: -os?(i)o (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ōi (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ōd (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -(e|o)i (older)
      • athematic singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • athematic singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in velar or bilabial stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -?s (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: (-?s)|(-s (<,–))|(-∅ (–)) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?n (<,–) (older)
      • consonant-stem not in -n- or stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ei (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: -i (older)
      • i/u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -īd (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) (older)
      • i-stem singular dative: -ei (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: -ei (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ūd (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular genitive: -ous (<), ?(-(e|o)s) (older)
      • u-stem singular locative: -(ē|ō)u (<) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ās (older)
      • a-stem plural animate accusative: -ans (older)
      • a-stem plural genitive: -ās(o|ō)m (older)
      • a-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ais (older)
      • o-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ōs (older)
      • o-stem plural animate accusative: -ons (older)
      • o-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -ā (older)
      • o-stem plural genitive: -(o|ō)m (older)
      • o-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ois (older)
      • athematic plural animate accusative: -ns (older)
      • athematic plural dative/ablative/locative: -(f|β)os (older)
      • athematic plural genitive: -(o|ō)m (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -es (older)
