      • i-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -ī (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -(ua|ū) (<) (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -oues (<) (older)

    Proto-Italic or later i/u-stem neuters

    The i- and u-stem neuter plural ending is re-shaped analogically to the either the o-stem (Sihler p. 317, 326) or the consonantal stem (Meiser p. 144, p. 146-147) neuter plural ending; alternatively, according to Meiser (p. 147), the u-stem might have just continued an original -ua ending. The plural change seems (Proto-)Italic (Meiser p. 144, Weiss p. 243, 252, Sihler p. 317, 326), less clear is the distribution beyond Latin of a (slightly controversial, see Meiser) u-stem singular in -ū, which may have been influenced by the original plural neuter before that got replaced in this step (Meiser p. 146; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 760; Weiss p. 252; Sihler p. 323).

    a o cons. -i- -u-
    &c. -i- -(g|k|b|p)- -(d|t)- -n- &c.
    sg:N -ā -os -?s (-?s)|(-s (<,–))|(-∅ (–)) -?n (<,–) -∅ (–) -s
    sg:V -(a|ā) -e (-e)|(-ī (<))
    sg:Ac -ām -om -m
    sg:n -om -∅ -∅ (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -ās -os?(i)o -(e|o)s -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -ous (<), ?(-(e|o)s)
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) -īd (<) -ūd (<)
    sg:D -āi -ōi -ei -ei (<) -ouei (<), -ou (<)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -(e|o)i -i -ei (<) -(ē|ō)u (<)
    pl:N/V -ās -ōs -es -ēs (<) -oues (<)
    pl:Ac -ans -ons -ns
    pl:n -ā -a -(a|ā)
    pl:G -ās(o|ō)m -(o|ō)m -(o|ō)m
    pl:D/Ab/L -ais -ois -(f|β)os
    • u-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: (-∅)|(-ū (<)) (Sihler p. 323; Meiser p. 144, 146; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 760; Weiss p. 252)
    • i/u-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -(a|ā) (Sihler p. 317, 326; Meiser p. 144, 147; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 758, 761; Weiss p. 243, 246, 252)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative: -ā (older)
      • a-stem singular animate vocative: -(a|ā) (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -ām (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ās (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ād (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (older)
      • o-stem singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: (-e)|(-ī (<)) (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular genitive: -os?(i)o (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ōi (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ōd (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -(e|o)i (older)
      • athematic singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • consonant-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in velar or bilabial stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -?s (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: (-?s)|(-s (<,–))|(-∅ (–)) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?n (<,–) (older)
      • consonant-stem not in -n- or stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ei (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: -i (older)
      • i/u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -īd (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) (older)
      • i-stem singular dative: -ei (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: -ei (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ūd (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular genitive: -ous (<), ?(-(e|o)s) (older)
      • u-stem singular dative: -ouei (<), -ou (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular locative: -(ē|ō)u (<) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ās (older)
      • a-stem plural animate accusative: -ans (older)
      • a-stem plural genitive: -ās(o|ō)m (older)
      • a-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ais (older)
      • o-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ōs (older)
      • o-stem plural animate accusative: -ons (older)
      • o-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -ā (older)
      • o-stem plural genitive: -(o|ō)m (older)
      • o-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ois (older)
      • athematic plural animate accusative: -ns (older)
      • athematic plural dative/ablative/locative: -(f|β)os (older)
      • athematic plural genitive: -(o|ō)m (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -es (older)
      • consonant-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -a (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -oues (<) (older)

    Emergence of the ē-declension between Proto-Italic and Early Latin

    The declension of some words with stems in -eu- and -ei- merges into its own dedicated declension, with stems ending in -ē-. The clearest influence is Proto-Indo-European *dieu-, which by Stang's Law had a singular PIE accusative *diē-m (rather than *dieu-m); this diē- was generalized as a stem to the singular nominative and beyond (Meiser p. 143-144; Weiss p. 253-254; Sihler p. 337-339). Similarly, i-stem *reHi-, after laryngeal loss *rei- or *rēi-, would, through loss of intervocalic -i- before endings starting in a vocal, produce a new stem rē- (Meiser p. 148; Weiss p. 254; Sihler p. 340-341). Some Italic forms other than Latin would make sense as parts of an ē-declension, but the evidence there is far from abundant or clear (Sihler p. 342; Bakkum p. 147; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 761, 763), so the declension's emergence should lie somwehere between Proto-Italic and first epigraphic attestations of its peculiarities in Latino-Faliscan around the 3rd century BCE. The earliest stages attested or assumed keep the regular endings of the athematic declensions, though possibly contracted (singular dative and genitive, plural nominative), or show analogy to a-declension endings with -ā- replaced by the stem's -ē-. Plurals are barely attested beyond rēs and diēs, and except for the nominative explained (Sihler p. 343) as analogies to other declensions, perfectly so by much later stages of those than what is highly speculatively depicted here. TODO: depict precursors in i- and u-stems, and thus the history of "bovis" too.

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    &c. -i- -(g|k|b|p)- -(d|t)- -n- &c.
    sg:N -ā -os -?s (-?s)|(-s (<,–))|(-∅ (–)) -?n (<,–) -∅ (–) -s -s
    sg:V -(a|ā) -e (-e)|(-ī (<))
    sg:Ac -ām -om -m -m
    sg:n -om -∅ -∅ (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -ās -os?(i)o -(e|o)s -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -ous (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -s
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) -īd (<) -ūd (<) -d, ?(-ē)
    sg:D -āi -ōi -ei -ei (<) -ouei (<), -ou (<) ?(-i), ?(-ei)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -(e|o)i -i -ei (<) -(ē|ō)u (<)
    pl:N/V -ās -ōs -es -ēs (<) -oues (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ans -ons -ns ?(-ns)
    pl:n -ā -a -(a|ā)
    pl:G -ās(o|ō)m -(o|ō)m -(o|ō)m ?(-s(o|ō)m)
    pl:D/Ab/L -ais -ois -(f|β)os ?(-(f|β)os)
    • ē-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (Sihler p. 338; Weiss p. 253)
    • ē-stem singular animate accusative: -m (Sihler p. 343)
    • ē-stem singular genitive: -s (Sihler p. 342; Meiser p. 147; Weiss p. 254-255)
    • ē-stem singular ablative: -d, ?(-ē) (Sihler p. 343; Meiser p. 148; Weiss p. 254-255; Bakkum p. 147)
    • ē-stem singular dative: ?(-i), ?(-ei) (Sihler p. 342-343; Meiser p. 148; Weiss p. 254-255; Leumann p. 446)
    • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (Sihler p. 343)
    • ē-stem plural animate accusative: ?(-ns) (Sihler p. 343)
    • ē-stem plural genitive: ?(-s(o|ō)m) (Sihler p. 343)
    • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: ?(-(f|β)os) (Sihler p. 343)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative: -ā (older)
      • a-stem singular animate vocative: -(a|ā) (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -ām (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ās (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ād (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (older)
      • o-stem singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: (-e)|(-ī (<)) (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular genitive: -os?(i)o (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ōi (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ōd (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -(e|o)i (older)
      • athematic singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • consonant-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in velar or bilabial stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -?s (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: (-?s)|(-s (<,–))|(-∅ (–)) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?n (<,–) (older)
      • consonant-stem not in -n- or stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ei (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: -i (older)
      • i/u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -īd (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) (older)
      • i-stem singular dative: -ei (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: -ei (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: (-∅)|(-ū (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ūd (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular genitive: -ous (<), ?(-(e|o)s) (older)
      • u-stem singular dative: -ouei (<), -ou (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular locative: -(ē|ō)u (<) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ās (older)
      • a-stem plural animate accusative: -ans (older)
      • a-stem plural genitive: -ās(o|ō)m (older)
      • a-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ais (older)
      • o-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ōs (older)
      • o-stem plural animate accusative: -ons (older)
      • o-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -ā (older)
      • o-stem plural genitive: -(o|ō)m (older)
      • o-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ois (older)
      • athematic plural animate accusative: -ns (older)
      • athematic plural dative/ablative/locative: -(f|β)os (older)
      • athematic plural genitive: -(o|ō)m (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -es (older)
      • consonant-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -a (older)
      • i/u-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -(a|ā) (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -oues (<) (older)

    Athematic nominative singulars between Proto-Italic and Early Latin

    Status of the nominative singular in athematic stems somewhere between Proto-Italic and Early Latin: For stems in -t-, -g-, -k- ("c" in Latin), -gʷʰ-,-gʰ-, -kʷ-, -b-, -p-, -m-, all further development now safely points to an ending -s. For stems in -ti-, the nominative singular in -ti-s is often syncopated (probably after two mores – Meiser p. 73, Leumann p. 98) to -t-s (at first). Forms in -(d|t)-s like the aforementioned assimilate further to -s-s. If a stem's -ti- is preceded by -n-, the preceding vowel is probably already lengthened (similarly with -di-, as in frōns/frondis – Sihler p. 316). Syncopated and unsyncopated forms of ti-stem nominative singular endings co-exist at least until Ennius and Plautus (Leumann p. 449). A stem ending in a velar fuses with the nominative ending -s to what's written as "-x" in Latin; notably, -gʰ and -gʷʰ- become -h- and -u- word-internally (Sihler p. 156, 158; Weiss p. 77, 79; Meiser p. 104), so the new stems ending in these also sport a nominative in -x. For stems ending -b-, the -b-s result was sometimes written as -p-s, and probably always spoken that way. For the m-stem we have (only?) "hiems", which was sometimes written "hiemps". A dental stop after a cosonant is eliminated in word-final position ("lac"/"lactis", "cor"/"cordis"). Latin shows some neuter ll-stems (genitives "mellis", "fellis" with the latter originally a stem in -ln, Sihler p. 298), where the ending simplifies -ll to -l. For n-stems, any (Pre?-)PIE *-o-n-s has safely become -ō (for "carō"/"carnis", the genitive can be explained by post-r-vowel syncopation of what otherwise could have been "carinis": Sihler p. 295), but some endings in -en also emerge, possibly from gender change or compounds with weakened root "can-" (Sihler p. 296).

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    &c. -i- -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -s- -n(d|t)i- -ti- &c
    sg:N -ā -os -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -ss (<) -∅ (–) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (–) -∅ (–) -ss ?(–) (<<), -s -ss (<<), -s -s -s -s
    sg:V -(a|ā) -e (-e)|(-ī (<))
    sg:Ac -ām -om -m -m
    sg:n -om -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -∅ -∅ -∅ (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -ās -os?(i)o -(e|o)s -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -ous (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -s
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) -īd (<) -ūd (<) -d, ?(-ē)
    sg:D -āi -ōi -ei -ei (<) -ouei (<), -ou (<) ?(-i), ?(-ei)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -(e|o)i -i -ei (<) -(ē|ō)u (<)
    pl:N/V -ās -ōs -es -ēs (<) -oues (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ans -ons -ns ?(-ns)
    pl:n -ā -a -(a|ā)
    pl:G -ās(o|ō)m -(o|ō)m -(o|ō)m ?(-s(o|ō)m)
    pl:D/Ab/L -ais -ois -(f|β)os ?(-(f|β)os)
      • consonant-stem in -p- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s
      • consonant-stem in -b- singular animate nominative/vocative: -(b|p)s (<)

      (Sihler p. 203-204, 283; Meiser p. 113; Weiss p. 190-191; Leumann p. 221-222)

    • consonant stem in -(g|c|v|h)- singular animate nominative/vocative: -x (<) (Sihler p. 204, 283; Meiser p. 47, 113; Weiss p. 170)
    • consonant-stem in -m- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?(p)s (Sihler p. 304; Leumann p. 212, 221-222; Meiser p. 113; Weiss p. 171, 190-191, 241)
    • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<) (Sihler p. 204-205, 283; Meiser p. 113-114; Weiss p. 170, 316; Leumann p. 220, 222)
      • some i-stems in -ndi- or -nti- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss ?(–) (<<), -s
      • some i-stems in -ti- (not -nti-) singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<<), -s

      (Sihler p. 204-205, 316, 318; Meiser p. 73, 113-114; Weiss p. 170, 316; Leumann p. 98, 342-343, 449)

    • consonant-stem in dental stop after consonant singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (<) (Sihler p. 230; Meiser p. 113-114; Weiss p. 190-191, 238; Leumann p. 221, 449)
    • consonant-stem in -l- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) (Sihler p. 304; Meiser p. 114; Leumann p. 213, 220)
    • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) (Sihler p. 295-296; Meiser p. 141; Weiss p. 310-311; Leumann p. 360, 363-364, 371)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative: -ā (older)
      • a-stem singular animate vocative: -(a|ā) (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -ām (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ās (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ād (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (older)
      • o-stem singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: (-e)|(-ī (<)) (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular genitive: -os?(i)o (older)

      • o-stem singular locative: -(e|o)i (older)

      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in -s- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -s- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)

      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -oues (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular genitive: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular dative: ?(-i), ?(-ei) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • ē-stem singular ablative: -d, ?(-ē) (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate accusative: ?(-ns) (older)
      • ē-stem plural genitive: ?(-s(o|ō)m) (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: ?(-(f|β)os) (older)

    The o-stem singular genitive from possibly Celtic to Latino-Faliscan

    Proto-Indo-European -os?(i)o is continued as -osio possibly even into Archaic Latin (Bakkum p. 132-134; Meiser p. 133-145; Weiss p. 222). An ending -ī of uncertain origin replaces this in Latin, but also turns up in Venetic (which, if part of the Italic family, split off from it early; Beekes p. 25; Fortson p. 127, 465-466), Faliscan, and even Celtic languages. This may continue a Proto-Italic or even Proto-Italo-Celtic ending. Or it may be the result of more recent morphological borrowing between languages in close contact on the Italian Peninsula (Clackson/Horrocks p. 32). The -ī ending may continue a suffix -iH that marks familial affiliation (Beekes p. 212; Meier-Brügger p. 333; Meiser p. 135). After -i-, the new ending contracted with the preceding vowel.

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    &c. -i- -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -m- -l- -n- -r- -s- -n(d|t)i- -ti- &c
    sg:N -ā -os -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -ss (<) -?(p)s -∅ (–) -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (–) -∅ (–) -ss ?(–) (<<), -s -ss (<<), -s -s -s -s
    sg:V -(a|ā) -e (-e)|(-ī (<))
    sg:Ac -ām -om -m -m
    sg:n -om -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -∅ -∅ -∅ (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -ās -osio, -ī -osio, -ī (<) -(e|o)s -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -ous (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -s
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) -īd (<) -ūd (<) -d, ?(-ē)
    sg:D -āi -ōi -ei -ei (<) -ouei (<), -ou (<) ?(-i), ?(-ei)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -(e|o)i -i -ei (<) -(ē|ō)u (<)
    pl:N/V -ās -ōs -es -ēs (<) -oues (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ans -ons -ns ?(-ns)
    pl:n -ā -a -(a|ā)
    pl:G -ās(o|ō)m -(o|ō)m -(o|ō)m ?(-s(o|ō)m)
    pl:D/Ab/L -ais -ois -(f|β)os ?(-(f|β)os)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular genitive: -osio, -ī
      • o-stem in -i- singular genitive: -osio, -ī (<)

      (Beekes p. 212-213; Clackson/Horrocks p. 16-17, 32; Fortson p. 127, 466; Meier-Brügger p. 333; Meiser p. 133-135; Sihler p. 259-260; Weiss p. 222-223; Leumann p. 424-425)

      • a-stem singular animate nominative: -ā (older)
      • a-stem singular animate vocative: -(a|ā) (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -ām (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ās (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ād (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (older)
      • o-stem singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: (-e)|(-ī (<)) (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ōi (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ōd (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -(e|o)i (older)
      • athematic singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after vowel singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after consonant singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in -s- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in -p- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -b- singular animate nominative/vocative: -(b|p)s (<) (older)
      • consonant stem in -(g|c|v|h)- singular animate nominative/vocative: -x (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -m- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?(p)s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -s- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ei (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: -i (older)
      • u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • some i-stems in -ndi- or -nti- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss ?(–) (<<), -s (older)
      • some i-stems in -ti- (not -nti-) singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<<), -s (older)
      • i-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)

      • ē-stem singular genitive: -s (older)

      • ē-stem singular ablative: -d, ?(-ē) (older)

      • ē-stem plural animate accusative: ?(-ns) (older)
      • ē-stem plural genitive: ?(-s(o|ō)m) (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: ?(-(f|β)os) (older)

    Proto-Italic or Proto-Latino-Faliscan vowel shortening before -m

    Long vowels before -m are shortened (Sihler p. 78, Meiser p. 77). The chronology is disputed. The shortening is shared with Celtic and Slavic, so might be early; but regular sound change would then have turned endings in -am into -em (Sihler p. 65). There is also evidence for -ām in Italic Oscan. Meiser (as do Weiss p. 233; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 755-757) opts for a late change, while Sihler explains away outliers to the expected development from an early change by leveling / influence from other endings that contain -a- (in Latin) or -ā- (in Oscan). Weiss p. 224 proposes a later shortening happening independently in Sabellic.

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    &c -i- -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -s- -n(d|t)i- -ti- &c
    sg:N -ā -os -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -ss (<) -∅ (–) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (–) -∅ (–) -ss ?(–) (<<), -s -ss (<<), -s -s -s -s
    sg:V -(a|ā) -e (-e)|(-ī (<))
    sg:Ac -am -om -m -em (<)
    sg:n -om -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -∅ -∅ -∅ (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -ās -osio, -ī -osio, -ī (<) -(e|o)s -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -ous (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -s
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) -īd (<) -ūd (<) -d, ?(-ē)
    sg:D -āi -ōi -ei -ei (<) -ouei (<), -ou (<) ?(-i), ?(-ei)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -(e|o)i -i -ei (<) -(ē|ō)u (<)
    pl:N/V -ās -ōs -es -ēs (<) -oues (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ans -ons -ns ?(-ns)
    pl:n -ā -a -(a|ā)
    pl:G -āsom -om -om ?(-som)
    pl:D/Ab/L -ais -ois -(f|β)os ?(-(f|β)os)
    • a-stem singular animate accusative: -am (Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Sihler p. 78, 268; Meiser p. 77, 132; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 756; Weiss p. 233)
    • a-stem plural genitive: -āsom (Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Sihler p. 272; Meiser p. 132)
    • o-stem plural genitive: -om (Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Sihler p. 264; Meiser p. 134; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 755; Weiss p. 224)
    • athematic plural genitive: -om (Clackson/Horrocks p. 16; Sihler p. 286, 318, 327; Meiser p. 138, 144-145)
    • ē-stem plural genitive: ?(-som) (Sihler p. 343)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative: -ā (older)
      • a-stem singular animate vocative: -(a|ā) (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ās (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ād (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (older)
      • o-stem singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: (-e)|(-ī (<)) (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular genitive: -osio, -ī (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular genitive: -osio, -ī (<) (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ōi (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ōd (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -(e|o)i (older)
      • athematic singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after vowel singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after consonant singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in -s- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in -p- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -b- singular animate nominative/vocative: -(b|p)s (<) (older)
      • consonant stem in -(g|c|v|h)- singular animate nominative/vocative: -x (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -m- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?(p)s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -s- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ei (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: -i (older)
      • some i-stems in -ndi- or -nti- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss ?(–) (<<), -s (older)
      • some i-stems in -ti- (not -nti-) singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<<), -s (older)
      • i-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -īd (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) (older)
      • i-stem singular dative: -ei (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: -ei (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: (-∅)|(-ū (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ūd (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular genitive: -ous (<), ?(-(e|o)s) (older)
      • u-stem singular dative: -ouei (<), -ou (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular locative: -(ē|ō)u (<) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ās (older)
      • a-stem plural animate accusative: -ans (older)
      • a-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ais (older)
      • o-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ōs (older)
      • o-stem plural animate accusative: -ons (older)
      • o-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -ā (older)
      • o-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ois (older)
      • athematic plural animate accusative: -ns (older)
      • athematic plural dative/ablative/locative: -(f|β)os (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -es (older)
      • consonant-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -a (older)
      • i/u-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -(a|ā) (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -oues (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular genitive: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular dative: ?(-i), ?(-ei) (older)
      • ē-stem singular ablative: -d, ?(-ē) (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate accusative: ?(-ns) (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: ?(-(f|β)os) (older)

    Proto-Latino-Faliscan thematic plural animate nominatives/vocatives

    The o-stem plural animate nominative is replaced by the respective pronoun ending (contrast with Sabellic, which went the opposite way: Sihler p. 261). The a-stem plural animate nominative is re-modelled after this influence, although the -ās form is still used rarely in later centuries. Sihler p. 271 calls these usages "inherited", but they only seem to show up relatively late and might therefore be (Weiss p. 235) Sabellisms or even mere confusions with the accusative.

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    &c -i- -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -s- -n(d|t)i- -ti- &c
    sg:N -ā -os -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -ss (<) -∅ (–) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (–) -∅ (–) -ss ?(–) (<<), -s -ss (<<), -s -s -s -s
    sg:V -(a|ā) -e (-e)|(-ī (<))
    sg:Ac -am -om -m -em (<)
    sg:n -om -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -∅ -∅ -∅ (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -ās -osio, -ī -osio, -ī (<) -(e|o)s -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -ous (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -s
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) -īd (<) -ūd (<) -d, ?(-ē)
    sg:D -āi -ōi -ei -ei (<) -ouei (<), -ou (<) ?(-i), ?(-ei)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -(e|o)i -i -ei (<) -(ē|ō)u (<)
    pl:N/V -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) -oi -es -ēs (<) -oues (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ans -ons -ns ?(-ns)
    pl:n -ā -a -(a|ā)
    pl:G -āsom -om -om ?(-som)
    pl:D/Ab/L -ais -ois -(f|β)os ?(-(f|β)os)
    • o-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -oi (Meiser p. 136; Sihler p. 261; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 754; Bakkum p. 128)
    • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) (Meiser p. 132; Sihler p. 271; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 756; Weiss p. 235; Bakkum p. 124)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative: -ā (older)
      • a-stem singular animate vocative: -(a|ā) (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -am (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ās (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ād (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (older)
      • o-stem singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: (-e)|(-ī (<)) (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular genitive: -osio, -ī (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular genitive: -osio, -ī (<) (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ōi (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ōd (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -(e|o)i (older)
      • athematic singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after vowel singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after consonant singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in -s- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in -p- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -b- singular animate nominative/vocative: -(b|p)s (<) (older)
      • consonant stem in -(g|c|v|h)- singular animate nominative/vocative: -x (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -m- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?(p)s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -s- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ei (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: -i (older)
      • some i-stems in -ndi- or -nti- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss ?(–) (<<), -s (older)
      • some i-stems in -ti- (not -nti-) singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<<), -s (older)
      • i-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)

      • i-stem singular dative: -ei (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: -ei (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: (-∅)|(-ū (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ūd (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular genitive: -ous (<), ?(-(e|o)s) (older)
      • u-stem singular dative: -ouei (<), -ou (<) (older)

      • athematic plural animate accusative: -ns (older)
      • athematic plural dative/ablative/locative: -(f|β)os (older)
      • athematic plural genitive: -om (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -es (older)
      • consonant-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -a (older)
      • i/u-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -(a|ā) (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -oues (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular genitive: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular dative: ?(-i), ?(-ei) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular ablative: -d, ?(-ē) (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate accusative: ?(-ns) (older)
      • ē-stem plural genitive: ?(-som) (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: ?(-(f|β)os) (older)

    Proto-Latino-Faliscan treatment of syllabic nasals

    Syllabic nasals turn into nasals prefixed with an -e- (in Sabellic maybe with an -a-: Meiser p. 65; Fortson p. 277; Sihler p. 96; Weiss p. 94-95). In athematic n-stem neuters, the suffix was a syllabic nasal in the strong cases, while the weak cases were ablauting (to whatever later became -in- in Latin), so this accounts for the singular nominatives in -en there (Sihler p. 297-298).

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    &c -i- -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -s- -n(d|t)i- -ti- &c
    sg:N -ā -os -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -ss (<) -∅ (–) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (–) -∅ (–) -ss ?(–) (<<), -s -ss (<<), -s -s -s -s
    sg:V -(a|ā) -e (-e)|(-ī (<))
    sg:Ac -am -om -em -m -em (<)
    sg:n -om -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -en (<<) -∅ -∅ (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -ās -osio, -ī -osio, -ī (<) -(e|o)s -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -ous (<), ?(-(e|o)s) -s
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) -īd (<) -ūd (<) -d, ?(-ē)
    sg:D -āi -ōi -ei -ei (<) -ouei (<), -ou (<) ?(-i), ?(-ei)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -(e|o)i -i -ei (<) -(ē|ō)u (<)
    pl:N/V -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) -oi -es -ēs (<) -oues (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ans -ons -ens -ns ?(-ns)
    pl:n -ā -a -(a|ā)
    pl:G -āsom -om -om ?(-som)
    pl:D/Ab/L -ais -ois -(f|β)os ?(-(f|β)os)
    • consonant-stem in -n-- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -en (<<) (Sihler p. 297-298; Leumann p. 369-372)
    • consonant-stem singular animate accusative: -em (Fortson p. 277; Sihler p. 284)
    • consonant-stem plural animate accusative: -ens (Fortson p. 277; Sihler p. 286)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative: -ā (older)
      • a-stem singular animate vocative: -(a|ā) (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -am (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ās (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ād (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (older)
      • o-stem singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: (-e)|(-ī (<)) (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular genitive: -osio, -ī (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular genitive: -osio, -ī (<) (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ōi (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ōd (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -(e|o)i (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after vowel singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after consonant singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -s- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in -p- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -b- singular animate nominative/vocative: -(b|p)s (<) (older)
      • consonant stem in -(g|c|v|h)- singular animate nominative/vocative: -x (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -m- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?(p)s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -s- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ei (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: -i (older)
      • some i-stems in -ndi- or -nti- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss ?(–) (<<), -s (older)
      • some i-stems in -ti- (not -nti-) singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<<), -s (older)
      • i-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • i/u-stem singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • i-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -īd (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)is (<), ?(-(e|o)s) (older)
      • i-stem singular dative: -ei (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: -ei (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: (-∅)|(-ū (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ūd (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular genitive: -ous (<), ?(-(e|o)s) (older)
      • u-stem singular dative: -ouei (<), -ou (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular locative: -(ē|ō)u (<) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate accusative: -ans (older)
      • a-stem plural genitive: -āsom (older)
      • a-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ais (older)
      • o-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -oi (older)
      • o-stem plural animate accusative: -ons (older)
      • o-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -ā (older)
      • o-stem plural genitive: -om (older)
      • o-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ois (older)
      • athematic plural dative/ablative/locative: -(f|β)os (older)
      • athematic plural genitive: -om (older)

      • consonant-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -a (older)
      • i/u-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -(a|ā) (older)
      • i/u-stem plural animate accusative: -ns (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -oues (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular genitive: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular dative: ?(-i), ?(-ei) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular ablative: -d, ?(-ē) (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate accusative: ?(-ns) (older)
      • ē-stem plural genitive: ?(-som) (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: ?(-(f|β)os) (older)

    Proto-Latino-Faliscan and Early Latin i- and u-stem singular genitives

    For both i- and u-stems, a singular genitive ending is found that may either continue a possible Proto-Indo-European -(e|o)s ending for these very same stems that would have existed alongside the -(e|o)is and -(e|o)us endings, or import the identical consonant-stem ending. In the u-stems, this ending is merely appended to the suffix. In the i-stems, the e-grade may either have replaced the stem-final -i- to -e-s, or (Sihler p. 316-317; questioned by Weiss p. 245) syncopated from an intermediary -i-(e|o)s to -i-s.

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    &c -i- -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -s- -n(d|t)i- -ti- &c
    sg:N -ā -os -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -ss (<) -∅ (–) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (–) -∅ (–) -ss ?(–) (<<), -s -ss (<<), -s -s -s -s
    sg:V -(a|ā) -e (-e)|(-ī (<))
    sg:Ac -am -om -em -m -em (<)
    sg:n -om -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -en (<<) -∅ -∅ (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -ās -osio, -ī -osio, -ī (<) -(e|o)s -(e|o)is (<), -(e|i)s (<) -ous (<), -(e|o)s -s
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) -īd (<) -ūd (<) -d, ?(-ē)
    sg:D -āi -ōi -ei -ei (<) -ouei (<), -ou (<) ?(-i), ?(-ei)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -(e|o)i -i -ei (<) -(ē|ō)u (<)
    pl:N/V -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) -oi -es -ēs (<) -oues (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ans -ons -ens -ns ?(-ns)
    pl:n -ā -a -(a|ā)
    pl:G -āsom -om -om ?(-som)
    pl:D/Ab/L -ais -ois -(f|β)os ?(-(f|β)os)
    • i-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)is (<), -(e|i)s (<) (Meiser p. 139; Sihler p. 316-317; Weiss p. 245; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 759)
    • u-stem singular genitive: -ous (<), -(e|o)s (Meiser p. 145; Sihler p. 324; Weiss p. 251; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 761)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative: -ā (older)
      • a-stem singular animate vocative: -(a|ā) (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -am (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ās (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ād (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (older)
      • o-stem singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: (-e)|(-ī (<)) (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular genitive: -osio, -ī (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular genitive: -osio, -ī (<) (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ōi (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ōd (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -(e|o)i (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after vowel singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after consonant singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -s- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in -p- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -b- singular animate nominative/vocative: -(b|p)s (<) (older)
      • consonant stem in -(g|c|v|h)- singular animate nominative/vocative: -x (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -m- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?(p)s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -s- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular animate accusative: -em (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ei (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: -i (older)
      • some i-stems in -ndi- or -nti- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss ?(–) (<<), -s (older)
      • some i-stems in -ti- (not -nti-) singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<<), -s (older)
      • i-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • i/u-stem singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • i-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -īd (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular dative: -ei (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: -ei (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: (-∅)|(-ū (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ūd (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular dative: -ouei (<), -ou (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular locative: -(ē|ō)u (<) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate accusative: -ans (older)
      • a-stem plural genitive: -āsom (older)
      • a-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ais (older)
      • o-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -oi (older)
      • o-stem plural animate accusative: -ons (older)
      • o-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -ā (older)
      • o-stem plural genitive: -om (older)
      • o-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ois (older)
      • athematic plural dative/ablative/locative: -(f|β)os (older)
      • athematic plural genitive: -om (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -es (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate accusative: -ens (older)
      • consonant-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -a (older)
      • i/u-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -(a|ā) (older)
      • i/u-stem plural animate accusative: -ns (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -oues (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular genitive: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular dative: ?(-i), ?(-ei) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular ablative: -d, ?(-ē) (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate accusative: ?(-ns) (older)
      • ē-stem plural genitive: ?(-som) (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: ?(-(f|β)os) (older)

    Proto-Latino-Faliscan or Latin-only convergence of endings in -a/-ā

    All previous endings in -a and/or -ā converge to -a. The paths to this differ between Sihler and Meiser. For Sihler, endings in -ā at first prevail over endings in -a (a-stem singular vocative turns to -ā under the influence of the nominative (p. 268), and the consonantic plural neuter under the influence of the o-stem (p. 263)), and later ("[r]elatively late in the history of [Latin]", but "predat[ing] the loss of final -d") all word-final -ā turn to -a, due to "iambic shortening", the influence of the shortened -am ending, or a mysteriously singular vowel shift (p. 78-79, 266-267). Meiser cannot accept such a vowel shift (p. 77) and proposes an inverse generalization of -a endings prevailing over -ā endings (p. 132, 136; see also Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 756; Weiss p. 232)). Whether this convergence happened to the whole Latino-Faliscan branch or only Latin is unclear due to lack of vowel-length hints in the available Faliscan texts.

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    &c -i- -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -s- -n(d|t)i- -ti- &c
    sg:N -a -os -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -ss (<) -∅ (–) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (–) -∅ (–) -ss ?(–) (<<), -s -ss (<<), -s -s -s -s
    sg:V -e (-e)|(-ī (<))
    sg:Ac -am -om -em -m -em (<)
    sg:n -om -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -en (<<) -∅ -∅ (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -ās -osio, -ī -osio, -ī (<) -(e|o)s -(e|o)is (<), -(e|i)s (<) -ous (<), -(e|o)s -s
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) -īd (<) -ūd (<) -d, ?(-ē)
    sg:D -āi -ōi -ei -ei (<) -ouei (<), -ou (<) ?(-i), ?(-ei)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -(e|o)i -i -ei (<) -(ē|ō)u (<)
    pl:N/V -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) -oi -es -ēs (<) -oues (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ans -ons -ens -ns ?(-ns)
    pl:n -a
    pl:G -āsom -om -om ?(-som)
    pl:D/Ab/L -ais -ois -(f|β)os ?(-(f|β)os)
    • a-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -a (Sihler p. 78, 266-268; Meiser p. 131-132; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 756; Weiss p. 232)
    • non-a-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -a (Sihler p. 263, 317, 326; Meiser p. 107, 136, 144, 146-147; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 754, 758, 761; Weiss p. 225, 246, 252)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -am (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ās (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ād (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (older)
      • o-stem singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: (-e)|(-ī (<)) (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular genitive: -osio, -ī (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular genitive: -osio, -ī (<) (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ōi (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ōd (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -(e|o)i (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after vowel singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after consonant singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -s- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in -p- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -b- singular animate nominative/vocative: -(b|p)s (<) (older)
      • consonant stem in -(g|c|v|h)- singular animate nominative/vocative: -x (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -m- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?(p)s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -s- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular animate accusative: -em (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ei (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: -i (older)
      • some i-stems in -ndi- or -nti- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss ?(–) (<<), -s (older)

      • i-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)

      • athematic plural genitive: -om (older)

      • consonant-stem plural animate accusative: -ens (older)
      • i/u-stem plural animate accusative: -ns (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -oues (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular genitive: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular dative: ?(-i), ?(-ei) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular ablative: -d, ?(-ē) (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate accusative: ?(-ns) (older)
      • ē-stem plural genitive: ?(-som) (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: ?(-(f|β)os) (older)

    Earliest Latin sound change of athematic plural dative/ablative

    The -(f|β)- fricative in athematic dative/ablative endings changes to the voiced bilabial stop -b- (Sihler p. 147; Fortson p. 283; Meiser p. 101-103; Weiss p. 149).

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    &c -i- -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -s- -n(d|t)i- -ti- &c
    sg:N -a -os -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -ss (<) -∅ (–) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (–) -∅ (–) -ss ?(–) (<<), -s -ss (<<), -s -s -s -s
    sg:V -e (-e)|(-ī (<))
    sg:Ac -am -om -em -m -em (<)
    sg:n -om -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -en (<<) -∅ -∅ (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -ās -osio, -ī -osio, -ī (<) -(e|o)s -(e|o)is (<), -(e|i)s (<) -ous (<), -(e|o)s -s
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) -īd (<) -ūd (<) -d, ?(-ē)
    sg:D -āi -ōi -ei -ei (<) -ouei (<), -ou (<) ?(-i), ?(-ei)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -(e|o)i -i -ei (<) -(ē|ō)u (<)
    pl:N/V -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) -oi -es -ēs (<) -oues (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ans -ons -ens -ns ?(-ns)
    pl:n -a
    pl:G -āsom -om -om ?(-som)
    pl:D/Ab/L -ais -ois -bos ?(-bos)
    • athematic plural dative/ablative/locative: -bos (Sihler p. 286, 318; Meiser p. 145)
    • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: ?(-bos) (Sihler p. 343)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -a (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -am (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ās (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ād (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (older)
      • o-stem singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: (-e)|(-ī (<)) (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)

      • o-stem in -i- singular genitive: -osio, -ī (<) (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ōi (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ōd (older)

      • consonant-stem in -l- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -s- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in -p- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -b- singular animate nominative/vocative: -(b|p)s (<) (older)
      • consonant stem in -(g|c|v|h)- singular animate nominative/vocative: -x (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -m- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?(p)s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -s- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular animate accusative: -em (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ei (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: -i (older)
      • some i-stems in -ndi- or -nti- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss ?(–) (<<), -s (older)
      • some i-stems in -ti- (not -nti-) singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<<), -s (older)
      • i-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • i/u-stem singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • i-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -īd (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)is (<), -(e|i)s (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular dative: -ei (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: -ei (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: (-∅)|(-ū (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ūd (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular genitive: -ous (<), -(e|o)s (older)
      • u-stem singular dative: -ouei (<), -ou (<) (older)

      • consonant-stem plural animate accusative: -ens (older)
      • i/u-stem plural animate accusative: -ns (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -oues (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular genitive: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular dative: ?(-i), ?(-ei) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular ablative: -d, ?(-ē) (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate accusative: ?(-ns) (older)
      • ē-stem plural genitive: ?(-som) (older)

    Earliest Latin partial fusion of athematic endings

    The suffix-ending combination -i-bos, previously found in the plural dative/ablative of i-stems, encroaches upon the consonantal stems (and the u-stems, see below), probably as an import from there. Sihler p. 286 though argues that the new ending could just as well be an import from the u-stem: Both -i- and -u- here weakened early to an in-between sound that would only in writing be locked into either -i- or -u- again. In any case, this sound change is deemed the main reason -i-bos now also turns up for u-stems, with -u-bos attested rarely and not particularly early, therefore probably by later analogy or need for differentiation rather than as continuation of original -u-bos (Sihler p. 326; Weiss p. 252). More securly, the i-stem nominative/vocative plural ending -ēs encroaches upon the consontal stem, and the previous i-stem singular genitive ending -(e|o)is is completely pushed out by the -(e|i)s ending that is similar to the consonantal ending.

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    &c -i- -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -s- -n(d|t)i- -ti- &c
    sg:N -a -os -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -ss (<) -∅ (–) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (–) -∅ (–) -ss ?(–) (<<), -s -ss (<<), -s -s -s -s
    sg:V -e (-e)|(-ī (<))
    sg:Ac -am -om -em -em (<), -m -m -em (<)
    sg:n -om -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -en (<<) -∅ -∅ (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -ās -osio, -ī -osio, -ī (<) -(e|o)s -(e|i)s (<) -ous (<), -(e|o)s -s
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) -īd (<) -ūd (<) -d, ?(-ē)
    sg:D -āi -ōi -ei -ei (<) -ouei (<), -ou (<) ?(-i), ?(-ei)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -(e|o)i -i -ei (<) -(ē|ō)u (<)
    pl:N/V -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) -oi -ēs -ēs (<) -oues (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ans -ons -ens -ns ?(-ns)
    pl:n -a
    pl:G -āsom -om -om ?(-som)
    pl:D/Ab/L -ais -ois -ibos -bos -ibos (<), ?(-bos) ?(-bos)
    • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (Sihler p. 286, 318; Meiser p. 138-140; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 759; Weiss p. 245)
    • consonant-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ibos (Sihler p. 286, 318; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 759; Weiss p. 246)
    • u-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ibos (<), ?(-bos) (Sihler p. 326; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 761; Weiss p. 252; Meiser p. 145)
    • i-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<), -m (Sihler p. 316, 318; Meiser p. 138; Weiss p. 244; Leumann p. 439-440)
    • i-stem singular genitive: -(e|i)s (<) (Sihler p. 316-318; Meiser p. 139-140; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 759; Weiss p. 245)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -a (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -am (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ās (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ād (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (older)
      • o-stem singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: (-e)|(-ī (<)) (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular genitive: -osio, -ī (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular genitive: -osio, -ī (<) (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ōi (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ōd (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -(e|o)i (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after vowel singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after consonant singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -s- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in -p- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -b- singular animate nominative/vocative: -(b|p)s (<) (older)
      • consonant stem in -(g|c|v|h)- singular animate nominative/vocative: -x (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -m- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?(p)s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -s- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular animate accusative: -em (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ei (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: -i (older)
      • some i-stems in -ndi- or -nti- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss ?(–) (<<), -s (older)
      • some i-stems in -ti- (not -nti-) singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<<), -s (older)
      • i-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -īd (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular dative: -ei (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: -ei (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: (-∅)|(-ū (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ūd (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular genitive: -ous (<), -(e|o)s (older)
      • u-stem singular dative: -ouei (<), -ou (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular locative: -(ē|ō)u (<) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate accusative: -ans (older)
      • a-stem plural genitive: -āsom (older)
      • a-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ais (older)
      • non-a-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -a (older)
      • o-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -oi (older)
      • o-stem plural animate accusative: -ons (older)
      • o-stem plural genitive: -om (older)
      • o-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ois (older)
      • athematic plural genitive: -om (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate accusative: -ens (older)
      • i-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bos (older)
      • i/u-stem plural animate accusative: -ns (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -oues (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular genitive: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular dative: ?(-i), ?(-ei) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular ablative: -d, ?(-ē) (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate accusative: ?(-ns) (older)
      • ē-stem plural genitive: ?(-som) (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: ?(-bos) (older)

    Earliest Latin plural accusatives

    The various accusative plural -ns endings transform to -s with the preceding vowel lengthened (Sihler p. 215). For the a-stem, this may have happened much earlier – in Proto-Indo-European even, see Weiss p. 235-236, Meiser p. 133. For a similar interpretation regarding the o-stems, see Meiser p. 136, Weiss p. 206, and Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 2084. On both suggestions, also consider Sihler p. 229, 254.

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    &c -i- -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -s- -n(d|t)i- -ti- &c
    sg:N -a -os -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -ss (<) -∅ (–) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (–) -∅ (–) -ss ?(–) (<<), -s -ss (<<), -s -s -s -s
    sg:V -e (-e)|(-ī (<))
    sg:Ac -am -om -em -em (<), -m -m -em (<)
    sg:n -om -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -en (<<) -∅ -∅ (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -ās -osio, -ī -osio, -ī (<) -(e|o)s -(e|i)s (<) -ous (<), -(e|o)s -s
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) -īd (<) -ūd (<) -d, ?(-ē)
    sg:D -āi -ōi -ei -ei (<) -ouei (<), -ou (<) ?(-i), ?(-ei)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -(e|o)i -i -ei (<) -(ē|ō)u (<)
    pl:N/V -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) -oi -ēs -ēs (<) -oues (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ās -ōs -ēs -īs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:n -a
    pl:G -āsom -om -om ?(-som)
    pl:D/Ab/L -ais -ois -ibos -bos -ibos (<), ?(-bos) ?(-bos)
    • a-stem plural animate accusative: -ās (Meiser p. 131, 133; Sihler p. 271; Weiss p. 235-236)
    • o-stem plural animate accusative: -ōs (Meiser p. 135-136; Sihler p. 263; Weiss p. 224)
    • consonant-stem plural animate accusative: -ēs (Meiser p. 138, 144; Sihler p. 286)
    • i-stem plural animate accusative: -īs (<) (Meiser p. 138, 144; Sihler p. 317; Weiss p. 245)
    • u-stem plural animate accusative: -ūs (<) (Meiser p. 145; Sihler p. 326; Weiss p. 252)
    • ē-stem plural animate accusative: -s (Meiser p. 147; Sihler p. 343; Weiss p. 253)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -a (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -am (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ās (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ād (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (older)
      • o-stem singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: (-e)|(-ī (<)) (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular genitive: -osio, -ī (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular genitive: -osio, -ī (<) (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ōi (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ōd (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -(e|o)i (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after vowel singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after consonant singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -s- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in -p- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -b- singular animate nominative/vocative: -(b|p)s (<) (older)
      • consonant stem in -(g|c|v|h)- singular animate nominative/vocative: -x (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -m- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?(p)s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -s- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular animate accusative: -em (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: ?(-ēd), ?(-ē) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ei (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: -i (older)
      • some i-stems in -ndi- or -nti- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss ?(–) (<<), -s (older)
      • some i-stems in -ti- (not -nti-) singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<<), -s (older)
      • i-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<), -m (older)
      • i-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -īd (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular genitive: -(e|i)s (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular dative: -ei (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: -ei (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: (-∅)|(-ū (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ūd (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular genitive: -ous (<), -(e|o)s (older)
      • u-stem singular dative: -ouei (<), -ou (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular locative: -(ē|ō)u (<) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) (older)
      • a-stem plural genitive: -āsom (older)
      • a-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ais (older)
      • non-a-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -a (older)
      • o-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -oi (older)
      • o-stem plural genitive: -om (older)
      • o-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ois (older)
      • athematic plural genitive: -om (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ibos (older)
      • i-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bos (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -oues (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ibos (<), ?(-bos) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular genitive: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular dative: ?(-i), ?(-ei) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular ablative: -d, ?(-ē) (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural genitive: ?(-som) (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: ?(-bos) (older)

    Earliest (?) Latin loss of athematic singular locatives

    The athematic singular locatives seem to mostly disappear in Latin, with only a few traces either in adverbs (only "diū" for the u-stem; a few more, like "rūrī" and "temperī", for the i-stem) or the consonantal ablative later on (Meiser p. 138-139, 147; Weiss p. 245, 252; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 761).

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    &c -i- -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -s- -n(d|t)i- -ti- &c
    sg:N -a -os -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -ss (<) -∅ (–) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (–) -∅ (–) -ss ?(–) (<<), -s -ss (<<), -s -s -s -s
    sg:V -e (-e)|(-ī (<))
    sg:Ac -am -om -em -em (<), -m -m -em (<)
    sg:n -om -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -en (<<) -∅ -∅ (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -ās -osio, -ī -osio, -ī (<) -(e|o)s -(e|i)s (<) -ous (<), -(e|o)s -s
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē), ?(-i) -īd (<) -ūd (<) -d, ?(-ē)
    sg:D -āi -ōi -ei -ei (<) -ouei (<), -ou (<) ?(-i), ?(-ei)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -(e|o)i ?(-i) ?(-ei (<))
    pl:N/V -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) -oi -ēs -ēs (<) -oues (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ās -ōs -ēs -īs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:n -a
    pl:G -āsom -om -om ?(-som)
    pl:D/Ab/L -ais -ois -ibos -bos -ibos (<), ?(-bos) ?(-bos)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: ?(-ēd), ?(-ē), ?(-i)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: ?(-i)

      (Meiser p. 138-139; Sihler p. 285; Weiss p. 202, 204)

    • i-stem singular locative: ?(-ei (<)) (Meiser p. 139; Sihler p. 285; Weiss p. 245)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -a (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -am (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ās (older)

      • o-stem singular ablative: -ōd (older)

      • consonant-stem in -l- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) (older)

      • consonant-stem in -s- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in -p- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -b- singular animate nominative/vocative: -(b|p)s (<) (older)
      • consonant stem in -(g|c|v|h)- singular animate nominative/vocative: -x (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -m- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?(p)s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -s- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular animate accusative: -em (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)s (older)

      • some i-stems in -ti- (not -nti-) singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<<), -s (older)
      • i-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)

      • i-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<), -m (older)

      • ē-stem singular dative: ?(-i), ?(-ei) (older)

      • ē-stem singular ablative: -d, ?(-ē) (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate accusative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural genitive: ?(-som) (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: ?(-bos) (older)

    Old Latin loss of -osio genitive

    The o-stem singular genitive in -osio is barely found in pre-literary Latin (least controversial would be the sparse Lapis Satricanus inscription from the 6th or 5th century BCE), and by the 3rd century BCE seems to be replaced completely by -ī.

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    &c -i- -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -s- -n(d|t)i- -ti- &c
    sg:N -a -os -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -ss (<) -∅ (–) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (–) -∅ (–) -ss ?(–) (<<), -s -ss (<<), -s -s -s -s
    sg:V -e (-e)|(-ī (<))
    sg:Ac -am -om -em -em (<), -m -m -em (<)
    sg:n -om -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -en (<<) -∅ -∅ (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -ās -ī -ī (<) -(e|o)s -(e|i)s (<) -ous (<), -(e|o)s -s
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē), ?(-i) -īd (<) -ūd (<) -d, ?(-ē)
    sg:D -āi -ōi -ei -ei (<) -ouei (<), -ou (<) ?(-i), ?(-ei)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -(e|o)i ?(-i) ?(-ei (<))
    pl:N/V -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) -oi -ēs -ēs (<) -oues (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ās -ōs -ēs -īs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:n -a
    pl:G -āsom -om -om ?(-som)
    pl:D/Ab/L -ais -ois -ibos -bos -ibos (<), ?(-bos) ?(-bos)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular genitive: -ī
      • o-stem in -i- singular genitive: -ī (<)

      (Meiser p. 133-135; Sihler p. 260; Weiss p. 222-223; Bakkum p. 132; Leumann p. 424-425)

      • a-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -a (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -am (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ās (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ād (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (older)
      • o-stem singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: (-e)|(-ī (<)) (older)
