      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -s- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular animate accusative: -em (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: ?(-ēd), ?(-ē), ?(-i) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ei (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: ?(-i) (older)

      • u-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: (-∅)|(-ū (<)) (older)

      • u-stem singular genitive: -ous (<), -(e|o)s (older)
      • u-stem singular dative: -ouei (<), -ou (<) (older)

      • ē-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular genitive: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular dative: ?(-i), ?(-ei) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular ablative: -d, ?(-ē) (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate accusative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural genitive: ?(-som) (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: ?(-bos) (older)

    Old Latin syncope of -os, -es, -e after -r-

    The singular nominative and vocative endings -os and -e syncopate after -r- – certainly if -r- be post-consonantal, in which case -r- would become syllabic (-kros to -kr to -ker), but also in many cases if -r- be post-vocalic (see "puer", "vir", yet adjectives "ferus", "sincērus"). The timeline is vague, but a 500 BC inscription still has SAKROS, while post-vocalic -ros from earlier -sos via rhotacism never syncopates. Plautus has syncopated and un-syncopated forms, though the latter might be analogical restorations. A similar syncopic tendency is rarely expressed for -lo- stems (Ennius using "famul" instead of "famulus"; see Meiser p. 133, Weiss p. 221, Leumann p. 92). Similarly, post-consonantal -ri-s in i-stems syncopates to -r, i.e. -er (Leumann p. 98; Meiser p. 73; Weiss p. 243; Sihler p. 315). Furthermore, neuter -r(e|o)s-stem syncopates so that original *far(e|o)s- becomes *fars- (Sihler p. 306), assimilating (Meiser p. 116) to farr- (like genitive "farris", with the nominative simplifying the -rr-ending to "far"; Sihler p. 211).

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    -i- -Cr- -Vr- &c -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -s- -n(d|t)i- -ti- -Cri- &c
    sg:N -a -os -er (<) -∅, -os -os -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -ss (<) -∅ (–) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (–) -∅ (–) -ss ?(–) (<<), -s -ss (<<), -s -er (<<) -s -s -s
    sg:V (-e)|(-ī (<)) -∅, -e -e
    sg:Ac -am -om -em -em (<), -m -m -em (<)
    sg:n -om -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -en (<<) -∅ (< for stems in -rr-) -∅ -∅ (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -ās -ī (<) -ī -(e|o)s -(e|i)s (<) -ous (<), -(e|o)s -s
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē), ?(-i) -īd (<) -ūd (<) -d, ?(-ē)
    sg:D -āi -ōi -ei -ei (<) -ouei (<), -ou (<) ?(-i), ?(-ei)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -(e|o)i ?(-i) ?(-ei (<))
    pl:N/V -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) -oi -ēs -ēs (<) -oues (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ās -ōs -ēs -īs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:n -a
    pl:G -āsom -om -om ?(-som)
    pl:D/Ab/L -ais -ois -ibos -bos -ibos (<), ?(-bos) ?(-bos)
    • o-stem (in consonant + -r) singular animate nominative/vocative: -er (<) (Meiser p. 73, 133-134; Sihler p. 70, 256; Weiss p. 220-221; Leumann p. 142, 423-424)
    • i-stem in consonant + -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -er (<<) (Meiser p. 73; Sihler p. 315; Weiss p. 245; Leumann p. 98)
    • consonant-stem in -r- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -rr-) (Meiser p. 114, 116; Sihler p. 306; Leumann p. 220-221)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -a (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -am (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ās (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ād (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- or -r- singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: (-e)|(-ī (<)) (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- or -r- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular genitive: -ī (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular genitive: -ī (<) (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ōi (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ōd (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -(e|o)i (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after vowel singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after consonant singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -s- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in -p- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -b- singular animate nominative/vocative: -(b|p)s (<) (older)
      • consonant stem in -(g|c|v|h)- singular animate nominative/vocative: -x (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -m- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?(p)s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -s- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular animate accusative: -em (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: ?(-ēd), ?(-ē), ?(-i) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ei (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: ?(-i) (older)
      • some i-stems in -ndi- or -nti- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss ?(–) (<<), -s (older)
      • some i-stems in -ti- (not -nti-) singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<<), -s (older)
      • i-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • i-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<), -m (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -īd (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular genitive: -(e|i)s (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular dative: -ei (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: ?(-ei (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • u-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: (-∅)|(-ū (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ūd (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular genitive: -ous (<), -(e|o)s (older)
      • u-stem singular dative: -ouei (<), -ou (<) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate accusative: -ās (older)
      • a-stem plural genitive: -āsom (older)
      • a-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ais (older)
      • non-a-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -a (older)
      • o-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -oi (older)
      • o-stem plural animate accusative: -ōs (older)
      • o-stem plural genitive: -om (older)
      • o-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ois (older)
      • athematic plural genitive: -om (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate accusative: -ēs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ibos (older)
      • i-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bos (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (<) (older)
      • i-stem plural animate accusative: -īs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -oues (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate accusative: -ūs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ibos (<), ?(-bos) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular genitive: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular dative: ?(-i), ?(-ei) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular ablative: -d, ?(-ē) (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate accusative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural genitive: ?(-som) (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: ?(-bos) (older)

    Old Latin rhotacism

    By the 4th century BCE, any older intervocalic -s- has become -r- (Meiser p. 95; Sihler p. 171-173; Weiss p. 150-152; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 750).

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    -i- -Cr- -Vr- &c -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -n(d|t)i- -ti- -Cri- &c
    sg:N -a -os -er (<) -∅, -os -os -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -ss (<) -∅ (–) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (–), -s (<, –) -ss ?(–) (<<), -s -ss (<<), -s -er (<<) -s -s -s
    sg:V (-e)|(-ī (<)) -∅, -e -e
    sg:Ac -am -om -em -em (<), -m -m -em (<)
    sg:n -om -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -en (<<) -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) -∅ (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -ās -ī (<) -ī -(e|o)s -(e|i)s (<) -ous (<), -(e|o)s -s
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē), ?(-i) -īd (<) -ūd (<) -d, ?(-ē)
    sg:D -āi -ōi -ei -ei (<) -ouei (<), -ou (<) ?(-i), ?(-ei)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -(e|o)i ?(-i) ?(-ei (<))
    pl:N/V -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) -oi -ēs -ēs (<) -oues (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ās -ōs -ēs -īs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:n -a
    pl:G -ārom -om -om ?(-rom)
    pl:D/Ab/L -ais -ois -ibos -bos -ibos (<), ?(-bos) ?(-bos)
    • a-stem plural genitive: -ārom (Meiser p. 132; Sihler p. 272; Weiss p. 236)
    • ē-stem plural genitive: ?(-rom) (Sihler p. 343)
    • consonant-stem in -r- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) (Sihler p. 305-306)
    • consonant-stem in -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–), -s (<, –) (Sihler p. 309)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -a (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -am (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ās (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ād (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem (in consonant + -r) singular animate nominative/vocative: -er (<) (older)
      • o-stem (in vowel + -r) singular animate nominative: -∅, -os (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- or -r- singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: (-e)|(-ī (<)) (older)
      • o-stem (in vowel + -r) singular animate vocative: -∅, -e (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- or -r- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular genitive: -ī (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular genitive: -ī (<) (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ōi (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ōd (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -(e|o)i (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after vowel singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after consonant singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -p- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -b- singular animate nominative/vocative: -(b|p)s (<) (older)
      • consonant stem in -(g|c|v|h)- singular animate nominative/vocative: -x (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -m- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?(p)s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular animate accusative: -em (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: ?(-ēd), ?(-ē), ?(-i) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ei (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: ?(-i) (older)
      • some i-stems in -ndi- or -nti- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss ?(–) (<<), -s (older)
      • some i-stems in -ti- (not -nti-) singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<<), -s (older)
      • i-stem in consonant + -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -er (<<) (older)
      • i-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • i-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<), -m (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -īd (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular genitive: -(e|i)s (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular dative: -ei (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: ?(-ei (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • u-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: (-∅)|(-ū (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ūd (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular genitive: -ous (<), -(e|o)s (older)
      • u-stem singular dative: -ouei (<), -ou (<) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate accusative: -ās (older)
      • a-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ais (older)
      • non-a-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -a (older)
      • o-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -oi (older)
      • o-stem plural animate accusative: -ōs (older)
      • o-stem plural genitive: -om (older)
      • o-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ois (older)
      • athematic plural genitive: -om (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate accusative: -ēs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ibos (older)
      • i-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bos (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (<) (older)
      • i-stem plural animate accusative: -īs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -oues (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate accusative: -ūs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ibos (<), ?(-bos) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular genitive: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular dative: ?(-i), ?(-ei) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular ablative: -d, ?(-ē) (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate accusative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: ?(-bos) (older)

    Old Latin a- and e-declension singular genitive in -ī

    During the 3rd century BCE (but see Weiss p. 234 for a possible 4th century BCE example), except for some fossilized forms like "pater familiās", the a-declension singular genitive is re-shaped by analogy with the o-stem, with -ī appended to -ā-. The ē-declension's singular genitive, similar to and probably already in its earlier form derived from the a-declension, follows this change, though in rare cases -s seems to be continued (see Leumann p. 447 for disagreement).

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    -i- -Cr- -Vr- &c -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -n(d|t)i- -ti- -Cri- &c
    sg:N -a -os -er (<) -∅, -os -os -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -ss (<) -∅ (–) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (–), -s (<, –) -ss ?(–) (<<), -s -ss (<<), -s -er (<<) -s -s -s
    sg:V (-e)|(-ī (<)) -∅, -e -e
    sg:Ac -am -om -em -em (<), -m -m -em (<)
    sg:n -om -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -en (<<) -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) -∅ (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -āī -ī (<) -ī -(e|o)s -(e|i)s (<) -ous (<), -(e|o)s -ī, ?(-s)
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē), ?(-i) -īd (<) -ūd (<) -d, ?(-ē)
    sg:D -āi -ōi -ei -ei (<) -ouei (<), -ou (<) ?(-i), ?(-ei)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -(e|o)i ?(-i) ?(-ei (<))
    pl:N/V -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) -oi -ēs -ēs (<) -oues (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ās -ōs -ēs -īs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:n -a
    pl:G -ārom -om -om ?(-rom)
    pl:D/Ab/L -ais -ois -ibos -bos -ibos (<), ?(-bos) ?(-bos)
    • a-stem singular genitive: -āī (Sihler p. 269; Bakkum p. 120-121; Meiser p. 130, 132; Weiss p. 234; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 756; Leumann p. 418-419)
    • ē-stem singular genitive: -ī, ?(-s) (Sihler p. 342; Meiser p. 147; Weiss p. 254; Leumann p. 446-447)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -a (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -am (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ād (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem (in consonant + -r) singular animate nominative/vocative: -er (<) (older)
      • o-stem (in vowel + -r) singular animate nominative: -∅, -os (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- or -r- singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: (-e)|(-ī (<)) (older)
      • o-stem (in vowel + -r) singular animate vocative: -∅, -e (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- or -r- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular genitive: -ī (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular genitive: -ī (<) (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ōi (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ōd (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -(e|o)i (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after vowel singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after consonant singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -p- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -b- singular animate nominative/vocative: -(b|p)s (<) (older)
      • consonant stem in -(g|c|v|h)- singular animate nominative/vocative: -x (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -m- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?(p)s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–), -s (<, –) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular animate accusative: -em (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: ?(-ēd), ?(-ē), ?(-i) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ei (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: ?(-i) (older)
      • some i-stems in -ndi- or -nti- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss ?(–) (<<), -s (older)
      • some i-stems in -ti- (not -nti-) singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<<), -s (older)
      • i-stem in consonant + -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -er (<<) (older)
      • i-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • i-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<), -m (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -īd (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular genitive: -(e|i)s (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular dative: -ei (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: ?(-ei (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • u-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: (-∅)|(-ū (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ūd (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular genitive: -ous (<), -(e|o)s (older)
      • u-stem singular dative: -ouei (<), -ou (<) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate accusative: -ās (older)
      • a-stem plural genitive: -ārom (older)
      • a-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ais (older)
      • non-a-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -a (older)
      • o-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -oi (older)
      • o-stem plural animate accusative: -ōs (older)
      • o-stem plural genitive: -om (older)
      • o-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ois (older)
      • athematic plural genitive: -om (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate accusative: -ēs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ibos (older)
      • i-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bos (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (<) (older)
      • i-stem plural animate accusative: -īs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -oues (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate accusative: -ūs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ibos (<), ?(-bos) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular dative: ?(-i), ?(-ei) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular ablative: -d, ?(-ē) (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate accusative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural genitive: ?(-rom) (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: ?(-bos) (older)

    Old Latin weakening of diphthongs

    By the 3rd century BCE, former dipththongs -ai- and -oi- of short length have weakened to -ei- in various inscriptions. The previous state is attested only for the o-stem plural nominative/vocative and ablative/dative – in an old inscription from the 6th century BCE, and the probably similarly ancient Carmen Saliare. That the a-stem diphthongs in the singular locative and the plural nominative/vocative survive this stage (to turn to Classical -ae) seems to affirm their greater length – see Weiss p. 235 for a discussion. (Regular PIE outcome for the a-stem singular locative would have been a short -ai at least before some initial sounds of the following words, thus -āi here may have been a generalized sandhi variant; but Weiss also points to an alternate theory by Francisco Villar whereby short -ai may have survived weakening too).

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    -i- -Cr- -Vr- &c -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -n(d|t)i- -ti- -Cri- &c
    sg:N -a -os -er (<) -∅, -os -os -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -ss (<) -∅ (–) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (–), -s (<, –) -ss ?(–) (<<), -s -ss (<<), -s -er (<<) -s -s -s
    sg:V (-e)|(-ī (<)) -∅, -e -e
    sg:Ac -am -om -em -em (<), -m -m -em (<)
    sg:n -om -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -en (<<) -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) -∅ (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -āī -ī (<) -ī -(e|o)s -(e|i)s (<) -ous (<), -(e|o)s -ī, ?(-s)
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē), ?(-i) -īd (<) -ūd (<) -d, ?(-ē)
    sg:D -āi -ōi -ei -ei (<) -ouei (<), -ou (<) ?(-i), ?(-ei)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -ei ?(-i) ?(-ei (<))
    pl:N/V -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) -ei -ēs -ēs (<) -oues (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ās -ōs -ēs -īs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:n -a
    pl:G -ārom -om -om ?(-rom)
    pl:D/Ab/L -eis -eis -ibos -bos -ibos (<), ?(-bos) ?(-bos)
    • o-stem singular locative: -ei (Sihler p. 260; Weiss p. 223; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 754)
    • a-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -eis (Meiser p. 131; Sihler p. 272; Weiss p. 236; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 756)
    • o-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ei (Meiser p. 134; Sihler p. 261; Weiss p. 223)
    • o-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -eis (Meiser p. 134; Sihler p. 263; Weiss p. 223; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 755)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -a (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -am (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -āī (older)

      • consonant-stem in -r- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) (older)

      • consonant-stem singular animate accusative: -em (older)

      • ē-stem plural genitive: ?(-rom) (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: ?(-bos) (older)

    Old Latin u-stem genitive singular

    The u-stem singular genitive exhibits a variety of forms up until the 2nd century BCE. Some continue the u-stem-original -ous and the consonantal-stem-influenced -u(e|o)s (as -uos in the Senatus Consultum de Bacchanalibus 187 BCE, and as -uis in Terence). But in Plautus mostly, and some inscriptions, is found -ī, in analogy to the o-declension.

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    -i- -Cr- -Vr- &c -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -n(d|t)i- -ti- -Cri- &c
    sg:N -a -os -er (<) -∅, -os -os -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -ss (<) -∅ (–) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (–), -s (<, –) -ss ?(–) (<<), -s -ss (<<), -s -er (<<) -s -s -s
    sg:V (-e)|(-ī (<)) -∅, -e -e
    sg:Ac -am -om -em -em (<), -m -m -em (<)
    sg:n -om -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -en (<<) -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) -∅ (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -āī -ī (<) -ī -(e|o)s -(e|i)s (<) -ī, -ous (<), -os, -is -ī, ?(-s)
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē), ?(-i) -īd (<) -ūd (<) -d, ?(-ē)
    sg:D -āi -ōi -ei -ei (<) -ouei (<), -ou (<) ?(-i), ?(-ei)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -ei ?(-i) ?(-ei (<))
    pl:N/V -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) -ei -ēs -ēs (<) -oues (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ās -ōs -ēs -īs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:n -a
    pl:G -ārom -om -om ?(-rom)
    pl:D/Ab/L -eis -eis -ibos -bos -ibos (<), ?(-bos) ?(-bos)
    • u-stem singular genitive: -ī, -ous (<), -os, -is (Meiser p. 145; Sihler p. 324; Weiss p. 251)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -a (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -am (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -āī (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ād (older)

      • o-stem in -i- singular animate nominative: -os (older)

      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)

      • o-stem singular ablative: -ōd (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -ei (older)

      • consonant-stem in dental stop after consonant singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -p- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -b- singular animate nominative/vocative: -(b|p)s (<) (older)
      • consonant stem in -(g|c|v|h)- singular animate nominative/vocative: -x (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -m- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?(p)s (older)

      • ē-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular ablative: -d, ?(-ē) (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)

      • ē-stem plural genitive: ?(-rom) (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: ?(-bos) (older)

    Old Latin initial stage of shortening and monophthongization of diphthongs

    By the 3rd century BCE, short diphthong -ei- probably monophthongizes to a somehwat higher -ē- (Meiser p. 58, 70-72 and Weiss p. 101, 143 argue for this; Sihler p. 53 allows for it, but calls the evidence "not rigorous"). Less epigraphic evidence is found for a monophthongization of -ou- to -ō- (Meiser p. 49; Weiss p. 103; not argued by Sihler). For quite a while, -EI- and -E- are found to interchangeably represent both the diphthong and the single vowel its monophthongization points to, i.e. EI is even found where -ē- (or later -ī-) would have no ancestry in -ei-; the situation seems to be similar with -OU- and -O-. Furthermore, by the 3rd century BCE at latest, the long diphthong ending -ōi of the o-stem singular dative (still attested for the 6th century BCE) has lost its final glide, possibly (Meiser p. 72-73) due to a generalized Sandhi mechanism. The ē-declension's singular genitive and dative are depicted in possible intermediary stages between the attested outcome in Plautus, Terence etc., and their probable initial morphological construction (for the dative, either appending regular -ei to the stem's -ē-, or -ē-i by analogy with the a-declension's -ā-i; for the genitive, -ē-ī in analoge to the a-declension's -ā-ī).

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    -i- -Cr- -Vr- &c -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -n(d|t)i- -ti- -Cri- &c
    sg:N -a -os -er (<) -∅, -os -os -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -ss (<) -∅ (–) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (–), -s (<, –) -ss ?(–) (<<), -s -ss (<<), -s -er (<<) -s -s -s
    sg:V (-e)|(-ī (<)) -∅, -e -e
    sg:Ac -am -om -em -em (<), -m -m -em (<)
    sg:n -om -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -en (<<) -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) -∅ (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -āī -ī (<) -ī -(e|o)s -(e|i)s (<) -ī, -(ou|ō)s (<), -os, -is ?(-ē|(ei)) (<)), ?(-(e|ē)ī (<)), ?(-s)
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē), ?(-i) -īd (<) -ūd (<) -d, ?(-ē)
    sg:D -āi -ō -ē -ē (<) -(ou|ō|u)ē (<), -(ou|ō) (<) ?(-ē (<)) ?(-(e|ē)i (<))
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -ē ?(-i) ?(-ē (<))
    pl:N/V -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) -ē -ēs -ēs (<) -(ou|ō)es (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ās -ōs -ēs -īs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:n -a
    pl:G -ārom -om -om ?(-rom)
    pl:D/Ab/L -ēs -ēs -ibos -bos -ibos (<), ?(-bos) ?(-bos)
    • o-stem singular dative: -ō (Sihler p. 258; Meiser p. 72-73, 134-135; Klein/Joseph/Fritz p. 754; Weiss p. 222)
    • ē-stem singular dative: ?(-ē (<)) ?(-(e|ē)i (<)) (Sihler p. 342-343; Meiser p. 148; Weiss p. 254-255; Leumann p. 446-447)
    • ē-stem singular genitive: ?(-ē|(ei)) (<)), ?(-(e|ē)ī (<)), ?(-s) (Sihler p. 342; Meiser p. 147; Weiss p. 254; Leumann p. 446-447)
    • a-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ēs (Meiser p. 131; Weiss p. 236)
    • o-stem singular locative: -ē (Meiser p. 49, 135)
    • o-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ē (Meiser p. 134; Weiss p. 223)
    • o-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ēs (Meiser p. 134)
    • consonant-stem singular dative: -ē (Meiser p. 138; Sihler p. 284)
    • i-stem singular dative: -ē (<) (Meiser p. 138; Sihler p. 316)
    • i-stem singular locative: ?(-ē (<)) (Meiser p. 139; Sihler p. 285; Weiss p. 245)
    • u-stem singular genitive: -ī, -(ou|ō)s (<), -os, -is (Meiser p. 145; Sihler p. 324; Weiss p. 251)
    • u-stem singular dative: -(ou|ō|u)ē (<), -(ou|ō) (<) (Meiser p. 145-146; Sihler p. 323; Weiss p. 251)
    • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -(ou|ō)es (<) (Meiser p. 146; Sihler p. 325; Weiss p. 252)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -a (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -am (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -āī (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ād (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem (in consonant + -r) singular animate nominative/vocative: -er (<) (older)
      • o-stem (in vowel + -r) singular animate nominative: -∅, -os (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- or -r- singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: (-e)|(-ī (<)) (older)
      • o-stem (in vowel + -r) singular animate vocative: -∅, -e (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- or -r- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular genitive: -ī (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular genitive: -ī (<) (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ōd (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after vowel singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after consonant singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -p- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -b- singular animate nominative/vocative: -(b|p)s (<) (older)
      • consonant stem in -(g|c|v|h)- singular animate nominative/vocative: -x (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -m- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?(p)s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–), -s (<, –) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular animate accusative: -em (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: ?(-ēd), ?(-ē), ?(-i) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: ?(-i) (older)
      • some i-stems in -ndi- or -nti- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss ?(–) (<<), -s (older)
      • some i-stems in -ti- (not -nti-) singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<<), -s (older)
      • i-stem in consonant + -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -er (<<) (older)
      • i-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • i-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<), -m (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -īd (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular genitive: -(e|i)s (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • u-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: (-∅)|(-ū (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ūd (<) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate accusative: -ās (older)
      • a-stem plural genitive: -ārom (older)
      • non-a-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -a (older)
      • o-stem plural animate accusative: -ōs (older)
      • o-stem plural genitive: -om (older)
      • athematic plural genitive: -om (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate accusative: -ēs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ibos (older)
      • i-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bos (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (<) (older)
      • i-stem plural animate accusative: -īs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate accusative: -ūs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ibos (<), ?(-bos) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular ablative: -d, ?(-ē) (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate accusative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural genitive: ?(-rom) (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: ?(-bos) (older)

    Old Latin o-stem plural genitive

    From the 3rd century BCE on, an o-stem plural genitive in -ōrom (later -ōrum) is attested, which will more and more (but never completely) supplant original -om (later -um). It most probably derives from analogy with the a-declension.

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    -i- -Cr- -Vr- &c -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -n(d|t)i- -ti- -Cri- &c
    sg:N -a -os -er (<) -∅, -os -os -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -ss (<) -∅ (–) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (–), -s (<, –) -ss ?(–) (<<), -s -ss (<<), -s -er (<<) -s -s -s
    sg:V (-e)|(-ī (<)) -∅, -e -e
    sg:Ac -am -om -em -em (<), -m -m -em (<)
    sg:n -om -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -en (<<) -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) -∅ (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -āī -ī (<) -ī -(e|o)s -(e|i)s (<) -ī, -(ou|ō)s (<), -os, -is ?(-ē|(ei)) (<)), ?(-(e|ē)ī (<)), ?(-s)
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē), ?(-i) -īd (<) -ūd (<) -d, ?(-ē)
    sg:D -āi -ō -ē -ē (<) -(ou|ō|u)ē (<), -(ou|ō) (<) ?(-ē (<)) ?(-(e|ē)i (<))
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -ē ?(-i) ?(-ē (<))
    pl:N/V -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) -ē -ēs -ēs (<) -(ou|ō)es (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ās -ōs -ēs -īs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:n -a
    pl:G -ārom -ōrom, -om -om ?(-rom)
    pl:D/Ab/L -ēs -ēs -ibos -bos -ibos (<), ?(-bos) ?(-bos)
    • o-stem plural genitive: -ōrom, -om (Meiser p. 134, 136; Sihler p. 264-265; Weiss p. 224)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -a (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -am (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -āī (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ād (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem (in consonant + -r) singular animate nominative/vocative: -er (<) (older)
      • o-stem (in vowel + -r) singular animate nominative: -∅, -os (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- or -r- singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: (-e)|(-ī (<)) (older)
      • o-stem (in vowel + -r) singular animate vocative: -∅, -e (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- or -r- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular genitive: -ī (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular genitive: -ī (<) (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ō (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ōd (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -ē (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after vowel singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after consonant singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -p- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -b- singular animate nominative/vocative: -(b|p)s (<) (older)
      • consonant stem in -(g|c|v|h)- singular animate nominative/vocative: -x (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -m- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?(p)s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–), -s (<, –) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular animate accusative: -em (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: ?(-ēd), ?(-ē), ?(-i) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(e|o)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ē (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: ?(-i) (older)
      • some i-stems in -ndi- or -nti- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss ?(–) (<<), -s (older)
      • some i-stems in -ti- (not -nti-) singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<<), -s (older)
      • i-stem in consonant + -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -er (<<) (older)
      • i-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • i-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<), -m (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -īd (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular genitive: -(e|i)s (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular dative: -ē (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: ?(-ē (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • u-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: (-∅)|(-ū (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ūd (<) (older)

      • u-stem singular dative: -(ou|ō|u)ē (<), -(ou|ō) (<) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate accusative: -ās (older)
      • a-stem plural genitive: -ārom (older)
      • a-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ēs (older)

      • o-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ē (older)
      • o-stem plural animate accusative: -ōs (older)
      • o-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ēs (older)
      • athematic plural genitive: -om (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (older)

      • consonant-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ibos (older)
      • i-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bos (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (<) (older)
      • i-stem plural animate accusative: -īs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -(ou|ō)es (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate accusative: -ūs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ibos (<), ?(-bos) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular genitive: ?(-ē|(ei)) (<)), ?(-(e|ē)ī (<)), ?(-s) (older)
      • ē-stem singular dative: ?(-ē (<)) ?(-(e|ē)i (<)) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular ablative: -d, ?(-ē) (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate accusative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural genitive: ?(-rom) (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: ?(-bos) (older)

    Old Latin vowel reductions

    By the 3rd century BCE, in closed final syllables, short -o- becomes -u-, except after -(u|v)- (Meiser p. 71, 84; Sihler p. 66), and around the same time, short -e- in final closed syllables becomes -i-, except before nasals (Meiser p. 71; Sihler p. 65; Weiss p. 138 sees an early example around 350 BCE already). The io-stem singular vocative definitely contracts to -ī, except "als grammatische Normierung oder gräzisierend in stilisierter alter Dichtung" (Leumann p. 424), as in Livius Andronicus.

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    -u- -i- -Cr- -Vr- &c -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -n(d|t)i- -ti- -Cri- &c
    sg:N -a -os -us -er (<) -∅, -us -us -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -ss (<) -∅ (–) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (–), -s (<, –) -ss ?(–) (<<), -s -ss (<<), -s -er (<<) -s -s -s
    sg:V -e -ī (<) -∅, -e -e
    sg:Ac -am -om -um -em -em (<), -m -m -em (<)
    sg:n -om -um -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -en (<<) -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) -∅ (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -āī -ī -ī (<) -ī -(i|u)s -s -ī, -(ou|ō)s (<), -os, -is ?(-ē|(ei)) (<)), ?(-(e|ē)ī (<)), ?(-s)
    sg:Ab -ād -ōd ?(-ēd), ?(-ē), ?(-i) -īd (<) -ūd (<) -d, ?(-ē)
    sg:D -āi -ō -ē -ē (<) -(ou|ō|u)ē (<), -(ou|ō) (<) ?(-ē (<)) ?(-(e|ē)i (<))
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -ē ?(-i) ?(-ē (<))
    pl:N/V -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) -ē -ēs -ēs (<) -(ou|ō)es (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ās -ōs -ēs -īs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:n -a
    pl:G -ārum -ōrom, -om -ōrum, -um -um -um -om -rum
    pl:D/Ab/L -ēs -ēs -ibus -bus -ibus (<), ?(-bus) -bus
    • a-stem plural genitive: -ārum (Meiser p. 132; Sihler p. 272; Weiss p. 236)
    • o-stem not in -u- plural genitive: -ōrum, -um (Meiser p. 134, 136; Sihler p. 264-265; Weiss p. 224)
      • ē-stem plural genitive: -rum
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bus

      (Meiser p. 147; Sihler p. 343; Weiss p. 253)

    • o-stem not in -u- singular animate accusative: -um (Meiser p. 134; Sihler p. 258; Weiss p. 221)
    • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: -ī (<) (Meiser p. 134; Sihler p. 257-258; Weiss p. 221; Leumann p. 224)
    • o-stem not in -u- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -um (Meiser p. 134; Sihler p. 258; Weiss p. 225)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate nominative: -us
      • o-stem not in -u- or -i- or -r- singular animate nominative: -us

      (Meiser p. 133; Sihler p. 256; Weiss p. 220-221)

    • o-stem (in vowel + -r) singular animate nominative: -∅, -us (Meiser p. 133; Sihler p. 70, 256; Weiss p. 220-221; Leumann p. 142, 423)
    • i-stem singular genitive: -s (Sihler p. 316-318; Weiss p. 138, 245)
    • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(i|u)s (Meiser p. 138, 144; Sihler p. 285; Weiss p. 202)
    • consonant-stem plural genitive: -um (Meiser p. 138; Sihler p. 286)
    • i-stem plural genitive: -um (Meiser p. 144; Sihler p. 318; Weiss p. 246)
    • consonant-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ibus (Sihler p. 286; Weiss p. 246)
    • i-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bus (Meiser p. 144; Sihler p. 318; Weiss p. 246)
    • u-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ibus (<), ?(-bus) (Meiser p. 145; Sihler p. 326; Weiss p. 252)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -a (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -am (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -āī (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ād (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (older)
      • o-stem in -u- singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem (in consonant + -r) singular animate nominative/vocative: -er (<) (older)
      • o-stem in -u- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem (in vowel + -r) singular animate vocative: -∅, -e (older)
      • o-stem not in -u- or -i- or -r- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem in -u- singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem in -u- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem in -u- singular genitive: -ī (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular genitive: -ī (<) (older)
      • o-stem not in -u- or -i- singular genitive: -ī (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ō (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ōd (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -ē (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after vowel singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after consonant singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -p- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -b- singular animate nominative/vocative: -(b|p)s (<) (older)
      • consonant stem in -(g|c|v|h)- singular animate nominative/vocative: -x (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -m- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?(p)s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–), -s (<, –) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular animate accusative: -em (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: ?(-ēd), ?(-ē), ?(-i) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ē (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: ?(-i) (older)
      • some i-stems in -ndi- or -nti- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss ?(–) (<<), -s (older)
      • some i-stems in -ti- (not -nti-) singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<<), -s (older)
      • i-stem in consonant + -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -er (<<) (older)
      • i-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • i-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<), -m (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -īd (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular dative: -ē (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: ?(-ē (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • u-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: (-∅)|(-ū (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ūd (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular genitive: -ī, -(ou|ō)s (<), -os, -is (older)
      • u-stem singular dative: -(ou|ō|u)ē (<), -(ou|ō) (<) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate accusative: -ās (older)
      • a-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ēs (older)
      • non-a-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -a (older)
      • o-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ē (older)
      • o-stem plural animate accusative: -ōs (older)
      • o-stem in -u- plural genitive: -ōrom, -om (older)
      • o-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ēs (older)
      • u-stem plural genitive: -om (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate accusative: -ēs (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (<) (older)
      • i-stem plural animate accusative: -īs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -(ou|ō)es (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate accusative: -ūs (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular genitive: ?(-ē|(ei)) (<)), ?(-(e|ē)ī (<)), ?(-s) (older)
      • ē-stem singular dative: ?(-ē (<)) ?(-(e|ē)i (<)) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular ablative: -d, ?(-ē) (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate accusative: -s (older)

    Old Latin singular ablative and the loss of -d

    During the 3rd century BCE, word-final -d after long vowels is lost in speech, though still used in writing until the 2nd century BCE (Meiser p. 100; Weiss p. 155; Sihler p. 228). This accounts for most singular ablatives of Classical Latin, except for the consonant-stem ending in short -e. A consonant-stem ending -ED is attested epigraphically in the 3rd century BCE, but may be a false archaism (Weiss p. 238), and no continuation in -ē is found (unless one follows Sihler p. 285 arguing for the possibility that Classical -e might be a shortened -ē, but with that -ē deriving straight from the PIE instrumental); Classical Latin -e instead is thought to derive from the locative ending in -i, but how and when that might have become the ablative ending remains unclear (Sihler p. 285).

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    -u- -i- -Cr- -Vr- &c -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -n(d|t)i- -ti- -Cri- &c
    sg:N -a -os -us -er (<) -∅, -us -us -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -ss (<) -∅ (–) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (–), -s (<, –) -ss ?(–) (<<), -s -ss (<<), -s -er (<<) -s -s -s
    sg:V -e -ī (<) -∅, -e -e
    sg:Ac -am -om -um -em -em (<), -m -m -em (<)
    sg:n -om -um -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -en (<<) -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) -∅ (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -āī -ī -ī (<) -ī -(i|u)s -s -ī, -(ou|ō)s (<), -os, -is ?(-ē|(ei)) (<)), ?(-(e|ē)ī (<)), ?(-s)
    sg:Ab -ā -ō ?(-i), ?(-ē) -ī (<) -ū (<) -∅
    sg:D -āi -ō -ē -ē (<) -(ou|ō|u)ē (<), -(ou|ō) (<) ?(-ē (<)) ?(-(e|ē)i (<))
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -ē ?(-i) ?(-ē (<))
    pl:N/V -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) -ē -ēs -ēs (<) -(ou|ō)es (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ās -ōs -ēs -īs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:n -a
    pl:G -ārum -ōrom, -om -ōrum, -um -um -um -om -rum
    pl:D/Ab/L -ēs -ēs -ibus -bus -ibus (<), ?(-bus) -bus
    • a-stem singular ablative: -ā (Meiser p. 128, 132; Sihler p. 269; Weiss p. 233-234)
    • o-stem singular ablative: -ō (Meiser p. 134; Sihler p. 258; Weiss p. 222)
    • i-stem singular ablative: -ī (<) (Meiser p. 138; Sihler p. 317; Weiss p. 245)
    • u-stem singular ablative: -ū (<) (Meiser p. 144; Sihler p. 324; Weiss p. 252)
    • ē-stem singular ablative: -∅ (Meiser p. 147; Sihler p. 343; Weiss p. 253)
    • consonant-stem singular ablative: ?(-i), ?(-ē) (Meiser p. 138; Sihler p. 285; Weiss p. 202)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -a (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -am (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -āi (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -āī (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -(a|ā)i (older)

      • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)

      • ē-stem plural genitive: -rum (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bus (older)

    Old to Classical Latin fusion of i-stem plural nominative and accusative

    Into the Classical period, the consonant-stem accusative plural encroaches upon, and more and replaces, the i-stem ending. The parallelism of -ēs and -īs extends to the nominative plural (with many examples for -īs already in Plautus), probably in analogy to the formal identity of both cases in other declensions.

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    -u- -i- -Cr- -Vr- &c -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -n(d|t)i- -ti- -Cri- &c
    sg:N -a -os -us -er (<) -∅, -us -us -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -ss (<) -∅ (–) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (–), -s (<, –) -ss ?(–) (<<), -s -ss (<<), -s -er (<<) -s -s -s
    sg:V -e -ī (<) -∅, -e -e
    sg:Ac -am -om -um -em -em (<), -m -m -em (<)
    sg:n -om -um -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -en (<<) -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) -∅ (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -āī -ī -ī (<) -ī -(i|u)s -s -ī, -(ou|ō)s (<), -os, -is ?(-ē|(ei)) (<)), ?(-(e|ē)ī (<)), ?(-s)
    sg:Ab -ā -ō ?(-i), ?(-ē) -ī (<) -ū (<) -∅
    sg:D -āi -ō -ē -ē (<) -(ou|ō|u)ē (<), -(ou|ō) (<) ?(-ē (<)) ?(-(e|ē)i (<))
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -ē ?(-i) ?(-ē (<))
    pl:N/V -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) -ē -ēs -īs (<), -ēs (<) -(ou|ō)es (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ās -ōs -ēs -īs (<), -ēs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:n -a
    pl:G -ārum -ōrom, -om -ōrum, -um -um -um -om -rum
    pl:D/Ab/L -ēs -ēs -ibus -bus -ibus (<), ?(-bus) -bus
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -īs (<), -ēs (<)
      • i-stem plural animate accusative: -īs (<), -ēs (<)

      (Meiser p. 138; Weiss p. 245; Leumann p. 440; Sihler p. 317-318)

      • ē-stem plural genitive: -rum (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bus (older)

    Old Latin later stage of shortening and monophthongization of diphthongs

    Between the end of the 3rd century and the middle of the 2nd century BCE, the monophthongization of former -ei- has (after the possible intermediate stage of -ē-) developed to -ī-, and that of former -ou- to -ū- (after the possible intermediate stage of -ō-). The u-stem plural nominative/vocative ending -ūs may emerge from this with questionable syncope of a previous e-ablaut ending (from -ou-es); an alternate theory is that the accusative ending was used here in analogy to the nominative-accusative similarity among consonantal stems (Meiser p. 146; Sihler p. 325-326; Weiss p. 124, 252). The u-stem singular dative is depicted here in its final/Classical form as having a short -u- before the glide, which fits regular shortening of vowels before other vowels in Latin (Sihler p. 80) in case -ouei might have turned to something like -ūī in between. The singular genitive of the a-declension shortens to -ai; again, its ē-declension sibling seems to follow this development, but to what distribution of -ei, -ēī etc. precisely is a bit unclear; the same confusion holds true for the singular dative; a short diphthong -ei was probably preserved in monosyllabic words like "rei"; the dative in -ē might through loss of final glide directly continue -ēi rather than -ei (Weiss p. 255).

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    -u- -i- -Cr- -Vr- &c -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -n(d|t)i- -ti- -Cri- &c
    sg:N -a -os -us -er (<) -∅, -us -us -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -ss (<) -∅ (–) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (–), -s (<, –) -ss ?(–) (<<), -s -ss (<<), -s -er (<<) -s -s -s
    sg:V -e -ī (<) -∅, -e -e
    sg:Ac -am -om -um -em -em (<), -m -m -em (<)
    sg:n -om -um -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -en (<<) -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) -∅ (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -ai -ī -ī (<) -ī -(i|u)s -s -ī, -ūs (<), -os, -is -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<), -(e|ē)ī (<), ?(-s)
    sg:Ab -ā -ō ?(-i), ?(-ē) -ī (<) -ū (<) -∅
    sg:D -āi -ō -ī -ī (<) -ī, -ū (<) -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<)
    sg:L -(a|ā)i -ī ?(-i) ?(-ī (<))
    pl:N/V -(a|ā)i, ?(-ās) -ī -ēs -īs (<), -ēs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ās -ōs -ēs -īs (<), -ēs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:n -a
    pl:G -ārum -ōrom, -om -ōrum, -um -um -um -om -rum
    pl:D/Ab/L -īs -īs -ibus -bus -ibus (<), ?(-bus) -bus
    • a-stem singular genitive: -ai (Meiser p. 130, 132; Weiss p. 234; Leumann p. 418)
    • ē-stem singular genitive: -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<), -(e|ē)ī (<), ?(-s) (Meiser p. 147; Weiss p. 254; Sihler p. 342; Leumann p. 446-447)
    • u-stem singular genitive: -ī, -ūs (<), -os, -is (Meiser p. 145; Sihler p. 285; Weiss p. 251)
    • consonant-stem singular dative: -ī (Meiser p. 138; Sihler p. 70, 284; Weiss p. 201)
    • i-stem singular dative: -ī (<) (Meiser p. 138; Sihler p. 316; Weiss p. 244)
    • i-stem singular locative: ?(-ī (<)) (Meiser p. 139; Sihler p. 285; Weiss p. 245)
    • u-stem singular dative: -ī, -ū (<) (Meiser p. 145; Sihler p. 323; Weiss p. 251)
    • o-stem singular locative: -ī (Meiser p. 134-135; Sihler p. 260; Weiss p. 223)
    • ē-stem singular dative: -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<) (Sihler p. 342-343; Meiser p. 148; Weiss p. 254-255; Leumann p. 446-447)
    • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ūs (<) (Meiser p. 146; Sihler p. 325; Weiss p. 252)
    • o-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ī (Meiser p. 134; Sihler p. 261; Weiss p. 223)
    • a-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -īs (Meiser p. 131; Sihler p. 272; Weiss p. 236)
    • o-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -īs (Meiser p. 134; Sihler p. 263; Weiss p. 224)

      • i-stem plural genitive: -um (older)
      • i-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bus (older)
      • u-stem plural genitive: -om (older)
      • u-stem plural animate accusative: -ūs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ibus (<), ?(-bus) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular ablative: -∅ (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate accusative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural genitive: -rum (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bus (older)

    2nd century BCE endings in -e or -ae

    By the 2nd century BCE, word final short -i has become -e (Sihler p. 65; Meiser p. 72; Weiss p. 146), and even in the a-stem diphthong endings, where the final glide is now written as such (Weiss p. 103 for how this might indicate not just an epigraphic but a phonetic change). There is no indication for the -AE that emerges to describe a long diphthong -āe, and regularly any vowel would have shortened before another in Latin (Sihler p. 80, so Classical -ae is assumed from here on. The consonant-stem ablative in -e most plausibly continues an -i derived from the locative (but see Sihler p. 285 for alternate interpretations), and encroaches upon the i-stem declension.

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    -u- -i- -Cr- -Vr- &c -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -n(d|t)i- -ti- -Cri- &c
    sg:N -a -os -us -er (<) -∅, -us -us -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -ss (<) -∅ (–) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (–), -s (<, –) -ss ?(–) (<<), -s -ss (<<), -s -er (<<) -s -s -s
    sg:V -e -ī (<) -∅, -e -e
    sg:Ac -am -om -um -em -em (<), -m -m -em (<)
    sg:n -om -um -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -en (<<) -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) -e (<) (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -ae -ī -ī (<) -ī -(i|u)s -s -ī, -ūs (<), -os, -is -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<), -(e|ē)ī (<), ?(-s)
    sg:Ab -ā -ō -e -e (<), -ī (<) -ū (<) -∅
    sg:D -ae -ō -ī -ī (<) -ī, -ū (<) -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<)
    sg:L -ae -ī ?(-e) ?(-ī (<))
    pl:N/V -ae, ?(-ās) -ī -ēs -īs (<), -ēs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ās -ōs -ēs -īs (<), -ēs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:n -a
    pl:G -ārum -ōrom, -om -ōrum, -um -um -um -om -rum
    pl:D/Ab/L -īs -īs -ibus -bus -ibus (<), ?(-bus) -bus
    • a-stem singular dative: -ae (Meiser p. 129, 132; Sihler p. 268; Weiss p. 233)
    • a-stem singular genitive: -ae (Meiser p. 130, 132; Sihler p. 269; Weiss p. 234; Leumann p. 418)
    • a-stem singular locative: -ae (Meiser p. 131; Sihler p. 270; Weiss p. 235)
    • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ae, ?(-ās) (Meiser p. 130; Sihler p. 271; Weiss p. 235)
    • consonant-stem singular ablative: -e (Meiser p. 138; Sihler p. 285; Weiss p. 202)
    • i-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -e (<) (Meiser p. 144; Sihler p. 316; Leumann p. 434)
    • i-stem singular ablative: -e (<), -ī (<) (Meiser p. 138; Sihler p. 317-318; Weiss p. 245; Leumann p. 440)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -a (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -am (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ā (older)
      • o-stem in -u- singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem (in consonant + -r) singular animate nominative/vocative: -er (<) (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate nominative: -us (older)
      • o-stem not in -u- or -i- or -r- singular animate nominative: -us (older)
      • o-stem in -u- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem (in vowel + -r) singular animate nominative: -∅, -us (older)
      • o-stem (in vowel + -r) singular animate vocative: -∅, -e (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: -ī (<) (older)
      • o-stem not in -u- or -i- or -r- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem in -u- singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem not in -u- singular animate accusative: -um (older)
      • o-stem in -u- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem not in -u- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -um (older)
      • o-stem not in -u- or -i- singular genitive: -ī (older)
      • o-stem in -u- singular genitive: -ī (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular genitive: -ī (<) (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ō (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ō (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -ī (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after vowel singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after consonant singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -p- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -b- singular animate nominative/vocative: -(b|p)s (<) (older)
      • consonant stem in -(g|c|v|h)- singular animate nominative/vocative: -x (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -m- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?(p)s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–), -s (<, –) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular animate accusative: -em (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(i|u)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ī (older)
      • some i-stems in -ndi- or -nti- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss ?(–) (<<), -s (older)
      • some i-stems in -ti- (not -nti-) singular animate nominative/vocative: -ss (<<), -s (older)
      • i-stem in consonant + -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -er (<<) (older)
      • i-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<), -m (older)
      • i-stem singular genitive: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular dative: -ī (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: ?(-ī (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • u-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: (-∅)|(-ū (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ū (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular genitive: -ī, -ūs (<), -os, -is (older)
      • u-stem singular dative: -ī, -ū (<) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate accusative: -ās (older)
      • a-stem plural genitive: -ārum (older)
      • a-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -īs (older)
      • non-a-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -a (older)
      • o-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ī (older)
      • o-stem plural animate accusative: -ōs (older)

      • o-stem not in -u- plural genitive: -ōrum, -um (older)

      • u-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ibus (<), ?(-bus) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular genitive: -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<), -(e|ē)ī (<), ?(-s) (older)
      • ē-stem singular dative: -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular ablative: -∅ (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate accusative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural genitive: -rum (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bus (older)

    2nd century BCE reduction of -ss to -s

    Word-final -s-s (from -t-s) simplifies to -s (Plautus still has "miless" with final syllable scanning, but Ennius already has "miles" with final syllable scanning short – Leumann p. 222, Meiser p. 113-114).

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    -u- -i- -Cr- -Vr- &c -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -n(d|t)i- -ti- -Cri- &c
    sg:N -a -os -us -er (<) -∅, -us -us -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -s (<) -∅ (–) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (–), -s (<, –) -s (–) (<<), -s -s (<<), -s -er (<<) -s -s -s
    sg:V -e -ī (<) -∅, -e -e
    sg:Ac -am -om -um -em -em (<), -m -m -em (<)
    sg:n -om -um -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -en (<<) -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) -e (<) (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -ae -ī -ī (<) -ī -(i|u)s -s -ī, -ūs (<), -os, -is -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<), -(e|ē)ī (<), ?(-s)
    sg:Ab -ā -ō -e -e (<), -ī (<) -ū (<) -∅
    sg:D -ae -ō -ī -ī (<) -ī, -ū (<) -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<)
    sg:L -ae -ī ?(-e) ?(-ī (<))
    pl:N/V -ae, ?(-ās) -ī -ēs -īs (<), -ēs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ās -ōs -ēs -īs (<), -ēs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:n -a
    pl:G -ārum -ōrom, -om -ōrum, -um -um -um -om -rum
    pl:D/Ab/L -īs -īs -ibus -bus -ibus (<), ?(-bus) -bus
    • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (<) (Sihler p. 204-205, 283; Meiser p. 113-114; Weiss p. 170, 316; Leumann p. 220, 222)
      • some i-stems in -ndi- or -nti- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (–) (<<), -s
      • some i-stems in -ti- (not -nti-) singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (<<), -s

      (Sihler p. 204-205, 316, 318; Meiser p. 73, 113-114; Weiss p. 170, 316; Leumann p. 98, 220, 222, 342-343, 449)

      • a-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -a (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -am (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -ae (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ae (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ā (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -ae (older)
      • o-stem in -u- singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem (in consonant + -r) singular animate nominative/vocative: -er (<) (older)

      • o-stem in -u- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem (in vowel + -r) singular animate nominative: -∅, -us (older)

      • o-stem not in -u- or -i- singular genitive: -ī (older)
      • o-stem in -u- singular genitive: -ī (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular genitive: -ī (<) (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ō (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ō (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -ī (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after vowel singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after consonant singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) (older)

      • consonant-stem in -r- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) (older)

      • consonant stem in -(g|c|v|h)- singular animate nominative/vocative: -x (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -m- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?(p)s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–), -s (<, –) (older)

      • ē-stem singular genitive: -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<), -(e|ē)ī (<), ?(-s) (older)
