      • ē-stem singular ablative: -∅ (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate accusative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural genitive: -rum (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bus (older)

    2nd century BCE loss of singular -e in some i-stem neuters

    By the 2nd century BCE (after -i had become -e, but with an example already in the Senatus consultum de Bacchanalibus – see Leumann p. 92), i-stem neuters in the singular nominative/accusative lose their ending after polysyllabic stems in -ā(r|l)-. Notably, this does not extend to adjectives (Weiss p. 147; p. 352). While Sihler p. 69, 316 sees this change only affect polysyllabic stems, Meiser p. 74 calls the -e in mar-e "restituiert".

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    -u- -i- -Cr- -Vr- &c -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -n(d|t)i- -ti- -Cri- &c
    sg:N -a -os -us -er (<) -∅, -us -us -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -s (<) -∅ (–) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (–), -s (<, –) -s (–) (<<), -s -s (<<), -s -er (<<) -s -s -s
    sg:V -e -ī (<) -∅, -e -e
    sg:Ac -am -om -um -em -em (<), -m -m -em (<)
    sg:n -om -um -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -en (<<) -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) -e (<), -∅ (<) (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -ae -ī -ī (<) -ī -(i|u)s -s -ī, -ūs (<), -os, -is -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<), -(e|ē)ī (<), ?(-s)
    sg:Ab -ā -ō -e -e (<), -ī (<) -ū (<) -∅
    sg:D -ae -ō -ī -ī (<) -ī, -ū (<) -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<)
    sg:L -ae -ī ?(-e) ?(-ī (<))
    pl:N/V -ae, ?(-ās) -ī -ēs -īs (<), -ēs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ās -ōs -ēs -īs (<), -ēs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:n -a
    pl:G -ārum -ōrom, -om -ōrum, -um -um -um -om -rum
    pl:D/Ab/L -īs -īs -ibus -bus -ibus (<), ?(-bus) -bus
    • i-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -e (<), -∅ (<) (Leumann p. 92, 111; Sihler p. 69, 79, 316; Weiss p. 147; Meiser p. 74)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -a (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -am (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -ae (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ae (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ā (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -ae (older)
      • o-stem in -u- singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem (in consonant + -r) singular animate nominative/vocative: -er (<) (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate nominative: -us (older)
      • o-stem not in -u- or -i- or -r- singular animate nominative: -us (older)
      • o-stem in -u- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem (in vowel + -r) singular animate nominative: -∅, -us (older)
      • o-stem (in vowel + -r) singular animate vocative: -∅, -e (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: -ī (<) (older)
      • o-stem not in -u- or -i- or -r- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem in -u- singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem not in -u- singular animate accusative: -um (older)
      • o-stem in -u- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem not in -u- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -um (older)
      • o-stem not in -u- or -i- singular genitive: -ī (older)
      • o-stem in -u- singular genitive: -ī (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular genitive: -ī (<) (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ō (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ō (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -ī (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after vowel singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after consonant singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -p- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -b- singular animate nominative/vocative: -(b|p)s (<) (older)
      • consonant stem in -(g|c|v|h)- singular animate nominative/vocative: -x (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -m- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?(p)s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (–), -s (<, –) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular animate accusative: -em (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: -e (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(i|u)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ī (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: ?(-e) (older)
      • some i-stems in -ndi- or -nti- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (–) (<<), -s (older)
      • some i-stems in -ti- (not -nti-) singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (<<), -s (older)
      • i-stem in consonant + -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -er (<<) (older)
      • i-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<), -m (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -e (<), -ī (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular genitive: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular dative: -ī (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: ?(-ī (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • u-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: (-∅)|(-ū (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ū (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular genitive: -ī, -ūs (<), -os, -is (older)
      • u-stem singular dative: -ī, -ū (<) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ae, ?(-ās) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate accusative: -ās (older)
      • a-stem plural genitive: -ārum (older)
      • a-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -īs (older)
      • non-a-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -a (older)
      • o-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ī (older)
      • o-stem plural animate accusative: -ōs (older)
      • o-stem in -u- plural genitive: -ōrom, -om (older)
      • o-stem not in -u- plural genitive: -ōrum, -um (older)
      • o-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -īs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural genitive: -um (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate accusative: -ēs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ibus (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -īs (<), -ēs (<) (older)
      • i-stem plural animate accusative: -īs (<), -ēs (<) (older)
      • i-stem plural genitive: -um (older)
      • i-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bus (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ūs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural genitive: -om (older)
      • u-stem plural animate accusative: -ūs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ibus (<), ?(-bus) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular genitive: -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<), -(e|ē)ī (<), ?(-s) (older)
      • ē-stem singular dative: -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular ablative: -∅ (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate accusative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural genitive: -rum (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bus (older)

    2nd century BCE shortening of vowels before -l and -r

    By the 2nd century BCE, in polysyllables, vowels in final syllables before -l and -r are shortened (Sihler p. 79; Weiss p. 128; Meiser p. 77; Leumann p. 111).

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    -u- -i- -Cr- -Vr- &c -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -n(d|t)i- -ti- -Cri- &c
    sg:N -a -os -us -er (<) -∅, -us -us -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -s (<) -∅ (v for poly-syl.) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (– for mono-, v for poly-syl.), -s (<, –) -s (–) (<<), -s -s (<<), -s -er (<<) -s -s -s
    sg:V -e -ī (<) -∅, -e -e
    sg:Ac -am -om -um -em -em (<), -m -m -em (<)
    sg:n -om -um -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -en (<<) -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) -e (<), -∅ (<, v) (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -ae -ī -ī (<) -ī -(i|u)s -s -ī, -ūs (<), -os, -is -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<), -(e|ē)ī (<), ?(-s)
    sg:Ab -ā -ō -e -e (<), -ī (<) -ū (<) -∅
    sg:D -ae -ō -ī -ī (<) -ī, -ū (<) -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<)
    sg:L -ae -ī ?(-e) ?(-ī (<))
    pl:N/V -ae, ?(-ās) -ī -ēs -īs (<), -ēs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ās -ōs -ēs -īs (<), -ēs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:n -a
    pl:G -ārum -ōrom, -om -ōrum, -um -um -um -om -rum
    pl:D/Ab/L -īs -īs -ibus -bus -ibus (<), ?(-bus) -bus
    • i-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -e (<), -∅ (<, v) (Leumann p. 92, 111; Sihler p. 69, 79, 316; Weiss p. 147; Meiser p. 74)
    • consonant-stem in -l- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (v for poly-syl.) (Leumann p. 111, 360; Sihler p. 304)
    • consonant-stem in -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (– for mono-, v for poly-syl.), -s (<, –) (Leumann p. 111; Sihler p. 293, 309; Weiss p. 129; Meiser p. 77)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -a (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -am (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -ae (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ae (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ā (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -ae (older)
      • o-stem in -u- singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem (in consonant + -r) singular animate nominative/vocative: -er (<) (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate nominative: -us (older)
      • o-stem not in -u- or -i- or -r- singular animate nominative: -us (older)
      • o-stem in -u- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem (in vowel + -r) singular animate nominative: -∅, -us (older)
      • o-stem (in vowel + -r) singular animate vocative: -∅, -e (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: -ī (<) (older)
      • o-stem not in -u- or -i- or -r- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem in -u- singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem not in -u- singular animate accusative: -um (older)
      • o-stem in -u- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem not in -u- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -um (older)
      • o-stem not in -u- or -i- singular genitive: -ī (older)
      • o-stem in -u- singular genitive: -ī (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular genitive: -ī (<) (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ō (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ō (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -ī (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after vowel singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after consonant singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -p- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -b- singular animate nominative/vocative: -(b|p)s (<) (older)
      • consonant stem in -(g|c|v|h)- singular animate nominative/vocative: -x (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -m- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?(p)s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular animate accusative: -em (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: -e (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(i|u)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ī (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: ?(-e) (older)
      • some i-stems in -ndi- or -nti- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (–) (<<), -s (older)
      • some i-stems in -ti- (not -nti-) singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (<<), -s (older)
      • i-stem in consonant + -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -er (<<) (older)
      • i-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<), -m (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -e (<), -ī (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular genitive: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular dative: -ī (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: ?(-ī (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • u-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: (-∅)|(-ū (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ū (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular genitive: -ī, -ūs (<), -os, -is (older)
      • u-stem singular dative: -ī, -ū (<) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ae, ?(-ās) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate accusative: -ās (older)
      • a-stem plural genitive: -ārum (older)
      • a-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -īs (older)
      • non-a-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -a (older)
      • o-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ī (older)
      • o-stem plural animate accusative: -ōs (older)
      • o-stem in -u- plural genitive: -ōrom, -om (older)
      • o-stem not in -u- plural genitive: -ōrum, -um (older)
      • o-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -īs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural genitive: -um (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate accusative: -ēs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ibus (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -īs (<), -ēs (<) (older)
      • i-stem plural animate accusative: -īs (<), -ēs (<) (older)
      • i-stem plural genitive: -um (older)
      • i-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bus (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ūs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural genitive: -om (older)
      • u-stem plural animate accusative: -ūs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ibus (<), ?(-bus) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular genitive: -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<), -(e|ē)ī (<), ?(-s) (older)
      • ē-stem singular dative: -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular ablative: -∅ (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate accusative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural genitive: -rum (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bus (older)

    2nd to 1st century BCE -ābus and -ubus endings

    From the 2nd century BCE on, analogical a-stem plural dative/ablative forms in -ābus are found next to regular -īs, plausibly to differentiate a-stem forms from o-stem ones. Similarly, a u-stem plural dative/ablative occasionally appears besides regular -ibus, which may continue an ancient regular form in -u-bus, or be a more recent analogy to differentiate the otherwise identical plural dative-ablatives of words like "arx" and "arcus"; in any case, it is safely attested from the 1st century BCE on.

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    -u- -i- -Cr- -Vr- &c -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -n(d|t)i- -ti- -Cri- &c
    sg:N -a -os -us -er (<) -∅, -us -us -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -s (<) -∅ (v for poly-syl.) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (– for mono-, v for poly-syl.), -s (<, –) -s (–) (<<), -s -s (<<), -s -er (<<) -s -s -s
    sg:V -e -ī (<) -∅, -e -e
    sg:Ac -am -om -um -em -em (<), -m -m -em (<)
    sg:n -om -um -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -en (<<) -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) -e (<), -∅ (<, v) (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -ae -ī -ī (<) -ī -(i|u)s -s -ī, -ūs (<), -os, -is -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<), -(e|ē)ī (<), ?(-s)
    sg:Ab -ā -ō -e -e (<), -ī (<) -ū (<) -∅
    sg:D -ae -ō -ī -ī (<) -ī, -ū (<) -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<)
    sg:L -ae -ī ?(-e) ?(-ī (<))
    pl:N/V -ae, ?(-ās) -ī -ēs -īs (<), -ēs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ās -ōs -ēs -īs (<), -ēs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:n -a
    pl:G -ārum -ōrom, -om -ōrum, -um -um -um -om -rum
    pl:D/Ab/L -īs, -ābus -īs -ibus -bus -bus, -ibus (<) -bus
    • a-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -īs, -ābus (Leumann p. 421-422; Sihler p. 272; Weiss p. 236; Meiser p. 131)
    • u-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bus, -ibus (<) (Leumann p. 443; Sihler p. 326; Weiss p. 252; Meiser p. 145)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -a (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -am (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -ae (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ae (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ā (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -ae (older)
      • o-stem in -u- singular animate nominative: -os (older)
      • o-stem (in consonant + -r) singular animate nominative/vocative: -er (<) (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate nominative: -us (older)
      • o-stem not in -u- or -i- or -r- singular animate nominative: -us (older)
      • o-stem in -u- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem (in vowel + -r) singular animate nominative: -∅, -us (older)
      • o-stem (in vowel + -r) singular animate vocative: -∅, -e (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: -ī (<) (older)
      • o-stem not in -u- or -i- or -r- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem in -u- singular animate accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem not in -u- singular animate accusative: -um (older)
      • o-stem in -u- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -om (older)
      • o-stem not in -u- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -um (older)
      • o-stem not in -u- or -i- singular genitive: -ī (older)
      • o-stem in -u- singular genitive: -ī (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular genitive: -ī (<) (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ō (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ō (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -ī (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after vowel singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after consonant singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -p- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -b- singular animate nominative/vocative: -(b|p)s (<) (older)
      • consonant stem in -(g|c|v|h)- singular animate nominative/vocative: -x (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (v for poly-syl.) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -m- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?(p)s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (– for mono-, v for poly-syl.), -s (<, –) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular animate accusative: -em (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: -e (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(i|u)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ī (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: ?(-e) (older)
      • some i-stems in -ndi- or -nti- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (–) (<<), -s (older)
      • some i-stems in -ti- (not -nti-) singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (<<), -s (older)
      • i-stem in consonant + -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -er (<<) (older)
      • i-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -e (<), -∅ (<, v) (older)
      • i-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<), -m (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -e (<), -ī (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular genitive: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular dative: -ī (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: ?(-ī (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • u-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: (-∅)|(-ū (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ū (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular genitive: -ī, -ūs (<), -os, -is (older)
      • u-stem singular dative: -ī, -ū (<) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ae, ?(-ās) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate accusative: -ās (older)
      • a-stem plural genitive: -ārum (older)

      • o-stem plural animate accusative: -ōs (older)
      • o-stem in -u- plural genitive: -ōrom, -om (older)
      • o-stem not in -u- plural genitive: -ōrum, -um (older)
      • o-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -īs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural genitive: -um (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate accusative: -ēs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ibus (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -īs (<), -ēs (<) (older)
      • i-stem plural animate accusative: -īs (<), -ēs (<) (older)
      • i-stem plural genitive: -um (older)
      • i-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bus (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ūs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural genitive: -om (older)
      • u-stem plural animate accusative: -ūs (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular genitive: -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<), -(e|ē)ī (<), ?(-s) (older)
      • ē-stem singular dative: -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular ablative: -∅ (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate accusative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural genitive: -rum (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bus (older)

    1st century BCE vowel reductions

    Around the end of the Republic, from the second half of the 1st century BCE on, earlier -o- becomes -u- even after -(u|v)- (Sihler p. 66, Meiser p. 84).

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    -i- -Cr- -Vr- &c -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -n(d|t)i- -ti- -Cri- &c
    sg:N -a -us -er (<) -∅, -us -us -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -s (<) -∅ (v for poly-syl.) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (– for mono-, v for poly-syl.), -s (<, –) -s (–) (<<), -s -s (<<), -s -er (<<) -s -s -s
    sg:V (-e)|(-ī (<)) -∅, -e -e
    sg:Ac -am -um -em -em (<), -m -m -em (<)
    sg:n -um -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -en (<<) -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) -e (<), -∅ (<, v) (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -ae -ī (<) -ī -(i|u)s -s -ī, -ūs (<), -os, -is -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<), -(e|ē)ī (<), ?(-s)
    sg:Ab -ā -ō -e -e (<), -ī (<) -ū (<) -∅
    sg:D -ae -ō -ī -ī (<) -ī, -ū (<) -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<)
    sg:L -ae -ī ?(-e) ?(-ī (<))
    pl:N/V -ae, ?(-ās) -ī -ēs -īs (<), -ēs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ās -ōs -ēs -īs (<), -ēs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:n -a
    pl:G -ārum -ōrum, -um -um -um -um -rum
    pl:D/Ab/L -īs, -ābus -īs -ibus -bus -bus, -ibus (<) -bus
    • u-stem plural genitive: -um (Meiser p. 145; Sihler p. 327; Weiss p. 252; Leumann p. 443)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -a (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -am (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -ae (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ae (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ā (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -ae (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate nominative: -us (older)
      • o-stem (in consonant + -r) singular animate nominative/vocative: -er (<) (older)
      • o-stem (in vowel + -r) singular animate nominative: -∅, -us (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- or -r- singular animate nominative: -us (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: (-e)|(-ī (<)) (older)
      • o-stem (in vowel + -r) singular animate vocative: -∅, -e (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- or -r- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -um (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -um (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular genitive: -ī (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular genitive: -ī (<) (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ō (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ō (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -ī (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after vowel singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after consonant singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -p- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -b- singular animate nominative/vocative: -(b|p)s (<) (older)
      • consonant stem in -(g|c|v|h)- singular animate nominative/vocative: -x (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (v for poly-syl.) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -m- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?(p)s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (– for mono-, v for poly-syl.), -s (<, –) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular animate accusative: -em (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: -e (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(i|u)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ī (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: ?(-e) (older)
      • some i-stems in -ndi- or -nti- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (–) (<<), -s (older)
      • some i-stems in -ti- (not -nti-) singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (<<), -s (older)
      • i-stem in consonant + -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -er (<<) (older)
      • i-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -e (<), -∅ (<, v) (older)
      • i-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<), -m (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -e (<), -ī (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular genitive: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular dative: -ī (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: ?(-ī (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • u-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: (-∅)|(-ū (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ū (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular genitive: -ī, -ūs (<), -os, -is (older)
      • u-stem singular dative: -ī, -ū (<) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ae, ?(-ās) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate accusative: -ās (older)
      • a-stem plural genitive: -ārum (older)
      • a-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -īs, -ābus (older)
      • non-a-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -a (older)
      • o-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ī (older)
      • o-stem plural animate accusative: -ōs (older)
      • o-stem plural genitive: -ōrum, -um (older)
      • o-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -īs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural genitive: -um (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate accusative: -ēs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ibus (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -īs (<), -ēs (<) (older)
      • i-stem plural animate accusative: -īs (<), -ēs (<) (older)
      • i-stem plural genitive: -um (older)
      • i-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bus (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ūs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural animate accusative: -ūs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bus, -ibus (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular genitive: -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<), -(e|ē)ī (<), ?(-s) (older)
      • ē-stem singular dative: -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular ablative: -∅ (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate accusative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural genitive: -rum (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bus (older)

    1st century BCE fusion of ē-stem singular genitive and dative

    Around the 1st century BCE, the similarity of the ē-stem's singular dative and genitive endings levels their remaining difference, i.e. the dative now may also scan as a long diphthong ending in -ī in authors such as Lucretius and Horace. A rule whereby the diphthong would be shorter -eī after consonants (fideī) but longer -ēī after -i- (diēī) is declared by Classical grammarians later on, but may just be "an artifact of schoolmasterly prescriptivism" (Sihler p. 342); except for monosyllables like "rei", the actual pronounciation of the ending was at this time probably mere -ī (from -ei) (Leumann p. 446-447).

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    -i- -Cr- -Vr- &c -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -n(d|t)i- -ti- -Cri- &c
    sg:N -a -us -er (<) -∅, -us -us -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -s (<) -∅ (v for poly-syl.) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (– for mono-, v for poly-syl.), -s (<, –) -s (–) (<<), -s -s (<<), -s -er (<<) -s -s -s
    sg:V (-e)|(-ī (<)) -∅, -e -e
    sg:Ac -am -um -em -em (<), -m -m -em (<)
    sg:n -um -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -en (<<) -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) -e (<), -∅ (<, v) (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -ae -ī (<) -ī -(i|u)s -s -ī, -ūs (<), -os, -is -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<), -(e|ē)ī (<)
    sg:D -ae -ō -ī -ī (<) -ī, -ū (<)
    sg:Ab -ā -ō -e -e (<), -ī (<) -ū (<) -∅
    sg:L -ae -ī ?(-e) ?(-ī (<))
    pl:N/V -ae, ?(-ās) -ī -ēs -īs (<), -ēs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ās -ōs -ēs -īs (<), -ēs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:n -a
    pl:G -ārum -ōrum, -um -um -um -um -rum
    pl:D/Ab/L -īs, -ābus -īs -ibus -bus -bus, -ibus (<) -bus
    • ē-stem singular genitive/dative: -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<), -(e|ē)ī (<) (Meiser p. 147-148; Sihler p. 342-343; Weiss p. 254-255; Leumann p. 446-447)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -a (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -am (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -ae (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ae (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ā (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -ae (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate nominative: -us (older)
      • o-stem (in consonant + -r) singular animate nominative/vocative: -er (<) (older)
      • o-stem (in vowel + -r) singular animate nominative: -∅, -us (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- or -r- singular animate nominative: -us (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: (-e)|(-ī (<)) (older)
      • o-stem (in vowel + -r) singular animate vocative: -∅, -e (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- or -r- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -um (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -um (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular genitive: -ī (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular genitive: -ī (<) (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ō (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ō (older)
      • o-stem singular locative: -ī (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after vowel singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after consonant singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -p- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -b- singular animate nominative/vocative: -(b|p)s (<) (older)
      • consonant stem in -(g|c|v|h)- singular animate nominative/vocative: -x (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (v for poly-syl.) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -m- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?(p)s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (– for mono-, v for poly-syl.), -s (<, –) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular animate accusative: -em (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: -e (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(i|u)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ī (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: ?(-e) (older)
      • some i-stems in -ndi- or -nti- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (–) (<<), -s (older)
      • some i-stems in -ti- (not -nti-) singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (<<), -s (older)
      • i-stem in consonant + -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -er (<<) (older)
      • i-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -e (<), -∅ (<, v) (older)
      • i-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<), -m (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -e (<), -ī (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular genitive: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular dative: -ī (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: ?(-ī (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • u-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: (-∅)|(-ū (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ū (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular genitive: -ī, -ūs (<), -os, -is (older)
      • u-stem singular dative: -ī, -ū (<) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ae, ?(-ās) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate accusative: -ās (older)
      • a-stem plural genitive: -ārum (older)
      • a-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -īs, -ābus (older)
      • non-a-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -a (older)
      • o-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ī (older)
      • o-stem plural animate accusative: -ōs (older)
      • o-stem plural genitive: -ōrum, -um (older)
      • o-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -īs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural genitive: -um (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate accusative: -ēs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ibus (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -īs (<), -ēs (<) (older)
      • i-stem plural animate accusative: -īs (<), -ēs (<) (older)
      • i-stem plural genitive: -um (older)
      • i-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bus (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ūs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural genitive: -um (older)
      • u-stem plural animate accusative: -ūs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bus, -ibus (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular ablative: -∅ (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate accusative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural genitive: -rum (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bus (older)

    1st century BCE o-stem ī-endings with/after -i-

    In the 1st century BCE, for o-stems in -i-, next to the contracted -ī in the singular genitive, a non-contracted -i-ī appears; at the same time, the locative in -i-ī contracts to -ī.

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    -i- -Cr- -Vr- &c -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -n(d|t)i- -ti- -Cri- &c
    sg:N -a -us -er (<) -∅, -us -us -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -s (<) -∅ (v for poly-syl.) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (– for mono-, v for poly-syl.), -s (<, –) -s (–) (<<), -s -s (<<), -s -er (<<) -s -s -s
    sg:V (-e)|(-ī (<)) -∅, -e -e
    sg:Ac -am -um -em -em (<), -m -m -em (<)
    sg:n -um -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -en (<<) -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) -e (<), -∅ (<, v) (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -ae -ī, -ī (<) -ī -(i|u)s -s -ī, -ūs (<), -os, -is -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<), -(e|ē)ī (<)
    sg:D -ae -ō -ī -ī (<) -ī, -ū (<)
    sg:Ab -ā -ō -e -e (<), -ī (<) -ū (<) -∅
    sg:L -ae -ī (<) -ī ?(-e) ?(-ī (<))
    pl:N/V -ae, ?(-ās) -ī -ēs -īs (<), -ēs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ās -ōs -ēs -īs (<), -ēs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:n -a
    pl:G -ārum -ōrum, -um -um -um -um -rum
    pl:D/Ab/L -īs, -ābus -īs -ibus -bus -bus, -ibus (<) -bus
    • o-stem in -i- singular genitive: -ī, -ī (<) (Meiser p. 134-135; Weiss p. 223; Leumann p. 424-425; Sihler p. 260)
    • o-stem in -i- singular locative: -ī (<) (Meiser p. 135; Weiss p. 223; Leumann p. 426-427)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -a (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -am (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -ae (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ae (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ā (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -ae (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate nominative: -us (older)
      • o-stem (in consonant + -r) singular animate nominative/vocative: -er (<) (older)
      • o-stem (in vowel + -r) singular animate nominative: -∅, -us (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- or -r- singular animate nominative: -us (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: (-e)|(-ī (<)) (older)
      • o-stem (in vowel + -r) singular animate vocative: -∅, -e (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- or -r- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -um (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -um (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular genitive: -ī (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ō (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ō (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular locative: -ī (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after vowel singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after consonant singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -p- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -b- singular animate nominative/vocative: -(b|p)s (<) (older)
      • consonant stem in -(g|c|v|h)- singular animate nominative/vocative: -x (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (v for poly-syl.) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -m- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?(p)s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (– for mono-, v for poly-syl.), -s (<, –) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular animate accusative: -em (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: -e (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(i|u)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ī (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: ?(-e) (older)
      • some i-stems in -ndi- or -nti- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (–) (<<), -s (older)
      • some i-stems in -ti- (not -nti-) singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (<<), -s (older)
      • i-stem in consonant + -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -er (<<) (older)
      • i-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -e (<), -∅ (<, v) (older)
      • i-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<), -m (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -e (<), -ī (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular genitive: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular dative: -ī (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: ?(-ī (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • u-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: (-∅)|(-ū (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ū (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular genitive: -ī, -ūs (<), -os, -is (older)
      • u-stem singular dative: -ī, -ū (<) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ae, ?(-ās) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate accusative: -ās (older)
      • a-stem plural genitive: -ārum (older)
      • a-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -īs, -ābus (older)
      • non-a-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -a (older)
      • o-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ī (older)
      • o-stem plural animate accusative: -ōs (older)
      • o-stem plural genitive: -ōrum, -um (older)
      • o-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -īs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural genitive: -um (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate accusative: -ēs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ibus (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -īs (<), -ēs (<) (older)
      • i-stem plural animate accusative: -īs (<), -ēs (<) (older)
      • i-stem plural genitive: -um (older)
      • i-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bus (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ūs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural genitive: -um (older)
      • u-stem plural animate accusative: -ūs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bus, -ibus (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular genitive/dative: -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<), -(e|ē)ī (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular ablative: -∅ (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate accusative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural genitive: -rum (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bus (older)

    Classical Latin loss and fossilization of older endings

    Various endings seem to have disappeared in Classical Latin, or only survive in fossilized forms, such as the o-stem plural genitive in -um, or some u-stem singular genitive endings. [TODO: consonant locative singular in -ī is modeled in analogy to o-stems (Sihler" p. 285). NOT DEPICTED: u-stem (or rather: ū-stem) freak cases "sūs" and "grūs" (Sihler p. 328); freak case "Iuppiter"/"Iovis" (Sihler p. 338-339); freak case "bōs"/"bovis" (Sihler p. 334-336); i- and mixed-stem freak cases of "senex"/"senis", "urbs"/"urbis", "nox"/"noctis", and s-stem root nouns with genitive plural in -ium, and the opposite with nominative singular in -is and otherwise consonant-stem endings (Sihler p. 319); kinship nouns of animate consonant stems in -r with nominative singular in -er (<) (like "pater"/"patris") (Sihler p. 293); consonant stems in -n- freak cases of "iuvenis"/"iuvenis", "sangu(i|ī)s"/"sanguinis", "liēn"/"li(e|ē)nis" (Sihler p. 291, 295-296, 298); consonant stems in -l- freak case of "sāl"/"salis" (Sihler p. 304); root noun freak cases of "vīs" and "spēs"/"speī" (Sihler p. 311); neuter r/n-stems freak cases of "femur"/"feminis", "iecur"/"iocineris", "iter"/"itineris" Sihler p. 298-299); nouns in -ēs nominative singular, mostly behaving like i-stem nouns (Sihler p. 316)]

    a o cons. -i- -u- -ē-
    -i- -Cr- -Vr- &c -p- -b- -(g|c|v|h)- -C(d|t)- -V(d|t)- -l- -m- -n- -r- -n(d|t)i- -ti- -Cri- &c
    sg:N -a -us -er (<) -∅, -us -us -s -(b|p)s (<) -x (<) -s (<) -∅ (v for poly-syl.) -?(p)s -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) -∅ (– for mono-, v for poly-syl.), -s (<, –) -s (–) (<<), -s -s (<<), -s -er (<<) -s -s -s
    sg:V (-e)|(-ī (<)) -∅ -e
    sg:Ac -am -um -em -em (<), -m -m -em (<)
    sg:n -um -∅ (<) -∅ -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) -en (<<) -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) -e (<), -∅ (<, v) (-∅)|(-ū (<))
    sg:G -ae -ī, -ī (<) -ī -(i|u)s -s -ūs (<), -is -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<), -(e|ē)ī (<)
    sg:D -ae -ō -ī -ī (<) -ī, -ū (<)
    sg:Ab -ā -ō -e -e (<), -ī (<) -ū (<) -∅
    sg:L -ae -ī (<) -ī ?(-e) ?(-ī (<))
    pl:N/V -ae, ?(-ās) -ī -ēs -īs (<), -ēs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:Ac -ās -ōs -ēs -īs (<), -ēs (<) -ūs (<) -s
    pl:n -a
    pl:G -ārum -ōrum -um -um -um -rum
    pl:D/Ab/L -īs, -ābus -īs -ibus -bus -bus, -ibus (<) -bus
    • o-stem plural genitive: -ōrum (Meiser p. 134; Sihler p. 264-265; Weiss p. 224; Leumann p. 428)
    • o-stem (in vowel + -r) singular animate vocative: -∅ (Meiser p. 134; Sihler p. 256; Weiss p. 221; Leumann p. 424)
      • a-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -a (older)
      • a-stem singular animate accusative: -am (older)
      • a-stem singular dative: -ae (older)
      • a-stem singular genitive: -ae (older)
      • a-stem singular ablative: -ā (older)
      • a-stem singular locative: -ae (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate nominative: -us (older)
      • o-stem (in consonant + -r) singular animate nominative/vocative: -er (<) (older)
      • o-stem (in vowel + -r) singular animate nominative: -∅, -us (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- or -r- singular animate nominative: -us (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular animate vocative: (-e)|(-ī (<)) (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- or -r- singular animate vocative: -e (older)
      • o-stem singular animate accusative: -um (older)
      • o-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -um (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular genitive: -ī (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular genitive: -ī, -ī (<) (older)
      • o-stem singular dative: -ō (older)
      • o-stem singular ablative: -ō (older)
      • o-stem not in -i- singular locative: -ī (older)
      • o-stem in -i- singular locative: -ī (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after vowel singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop after consonant singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -ll-) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -∅ (< for stems in -rr-), -s (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -p- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -b- singular animate nominative/vocative: -(b|p)s (<) (older)
      • consonant stem in -(g|c|v|h)- singular animate nominative/vocative: -x (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in dental stop singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -l- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (v for poly-syl.) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -m- singular animate nominative/vocative: -?(p)s (older)
      • consonant-stem in -n-- singular animate nominative/vocative: -ō (<<, < for stem in -rn-), -en (<<) (older)
      • consonant-stem in -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -∅ (– for mono-, v for poly-syl.), -s (<, –) (older)
      • consonant-stem singular animate accusative: -em (older)
      • consonant-stem singular ablative: -e (older)
      • consonant-stem singular genitive: -(i|u)s (older)
      • consonant-stem singular dative: -ī (older)
      • consonant-stem singular locative: ?(-e) (older)
      • some i-stems in -ndi- or -nti- singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (–) (<<), -s (older)
      • some i-stems in -ti- (not -nti-) singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (<<), -s (older)
      • i-stem in consonant + -r- singular animate nominative/vocative: -er (<<) (older)
      • i-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -e (<), -∅ (<, v) (older)
      • i-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<), -m (older)
      • i-stem singular ablative: -e (<), -ī (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular genitive: -s (older)
      • i-stem singular dative: -ī (<) (older)
      • i-stem singular locative: ?(-ī (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • u-stem singular inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: (-∅)|(-ū (<)) (older)
      • u-stem singular animate accusative: -m (older)
      • u-stem singular ablative: -ū (<) (older)
      • u-stem singular dative: -ī, -ū (<) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ae, ?(-ās) (older)
      • a-stem plural animate accusative: -ās (older)
      • a-stem plural genitive: -ārum (older)
      • a-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -īs, -ābus (older)
      • non-a-stem plural inanimate nominative/vocative/accusative: -a (older)
      • o-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ī (older)
      • o-stem plural animate accusative: -ōs (older)
      • o-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -īs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural genitive: -um (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ēs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural animate accusative: -ēs (older)
      • consonant-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -ibus (older)
      • i-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -īs (<), -ēs (<) (older)
      • i-stem plural animate accusative: -īs (<), -ēs (<) (older)
      • i-stem plural genitive: -um (older)
      • i-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bus (older)
      • u-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -ūs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural genitive: -um (older)
      • u-stem plural animate accusative: -ūs (<) (older)
      • u-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bus, -ibus (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem singular genitive/dative: -(ī|ē) (<), -ei (<), -(e|ē)ī (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular animate accusative: -em (<) (older)
      • ē-stem singular ablative: -∅ (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate nominative/vocative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural animate accusative: -s (older)
      • ē-stem plural genitive: -rum (older)
      • ē-stem plural dative/ablative/locative: -bus (older)

    Bibliography

    • Bakkum, Gabriel C. L. M.: The Latin Dialect of the Ager Faliscus. Amsterdam University Press 2009.
    • Beekes, Robert S. P.: Comparative Indo-European Linguistics: an Introduction. Second Edition. John Benjamins 2011.
    • Clackson, James / Horrocks, Geoffrey: The Blackwell History of the Latin Language. Blackwell 2007.
    • Fortson, Benjamin W.: Indo-European Language and Culture: an Introduction. Second Edition. Blackwell 2010.
    • Leumann, Manu: Lateinische Laut- und Formenlehre. C.H. Beck 1977.
    • Meier-Brügger, Michael: Indogermanische Sprachwissenschaft. 9. durchgesehene und ergänzte Auflage. De Gruyter 2010.
    • Meiser, Gerhard: Historische Laut- und Formenlehre der lateinischen Sprache. 2. Auflage. Wissenschaftliche Buchgesellschaft 2002.
    • Sihler, Andrew L.: New Comparative Grammar of Greek and Latin. Oxford University Press 1995.
    • Szemerényi, Oswald: Einführung in die vergleichende Sprachwissenschaft. 4., durchgesehene Auflage. Wissenschaftliche Buchgesellschaft 1990.
    • Klein, Jared & Joseph, Brian & Fritz, Matthias: Handbook of Comparative and Historical Linguistics. De Gruyter 2017.
    • Weiss, Michael: Outline of the Historical and Comparative Grammar of Latin. Beech Stave Press 2009.
